The Chirashi I had was decent, but I ordered a spicy tuna donburi expecting tekkadon, and instead got a salad of lettuce and tomato on rice with tuna, utterly disappointing. other sushi I had was fine.  Only ordered from them, never been there in person

Good food, great service.  They always deliver.  This is the best sushi restaurant in Henderson, and there are a LOT of them!  I once counted 12 on the Eastern corridor from the 215 to Anthem alone!  They always come through for us.  It's usually my wife and me and 3 kids - 1, 2 and 11.  We've probably been 100 times, because they're always consistently good.

Best Sushi and Sashimi ever -- Was up here for a Triathlon in Boulder City and we drove all the way to this west side location to try it since it had such good ratings. Well worth the extra trip and will be back next time I am in Vegas for anything!

So many sushi options to choose from. Definitely popular with locals (we came in on a Tuesday afternoon and I was surprised to see how busy it was). Decided on the boom boom nipple special and burning my stomach roll with the hubbs. Definitely good sushi but not the best. Too much sauce on the boom boom--and some orange sauce that was a little too tangy. Veggie and shrimp tempura was cooked just right--nice and crispy. Will be back :)

The best sushi place I have been to in such a long time. Everything that I have tried has been very good whether it be one of the menu items or a special request with the sushi bar. My favorites are still the Screaming Orgasm and Lisa Hand Roll. If you like tuna, you cannot go wrong with these two items. They are absolutely fantastic! I visit or get carry out usually a couple times a month. I've tried several other sushi places in the area and have decided to stop wasting my time with the disappointment and just stick with what continually exceeds expectations... I will stick with I Love Sushi!

They dont offer all you can eat sushi but this is by far the most delicious sushi ive had and spectacular fish!! Melts in my mouth every time, and the special thing about their fish, is that it doesnt have bad fishy smell u can encounter at other joints! One of my many date spots for sure! And the sushi bar is always fun and gets you involved!! I can suggest the ilovesushi special which is a tuna roll with this spicy sauce its fantastic!!

Definitely one of my favorite sushi spots in Las Vegas...the only downside (which really isn't, is the menu is HUGE, which makes it impossible to try everything even after 20 visits). Sitting at the sushi bar you truly feel as if you could be somewhere in Japan, and the waitresses in kimonos lends to the feel. We had the Dynamite, the seared peppered ahi with avocado and Double Ds, all of which were delicious.  We will absolutely be back...

Authentic sushi served in an energetic & noisy setting. We were seated at the bar right away & given complementary edamame, as well as cucumbers with kimchee sauce. This was given to us after we used warm towels for our hands.  Sushi was served to us right from the chefs. Hubby & I enjoyed the Monkey roll, the Spider roll & the Last Call roll. Definitely enough food for the two of us without feeling stuffed! Staff was friendly & attentive. Would recommend if you love sushi!

My favorite Sushi spot in Vegas. Great food and good service. My good friend lives around the corner and suggested it, he knows what to order. The screaming orgasm is highly suggested. It's a heaping pile of tuna on top of some sort of shaved radish with a secret sauce so good you'll want to drink it. You get a little house cucumber salad with some sort of fish and dressing, very good. They have a huge menu and that can be a little overwhelming, the waitress gave a few suggestions and she didn't let us down.

Huge menu. Something for everyone. Lots of seating, but the seats along the walls are best. Host has great specs. Real busy so when the waitress finally comes order everything you will ever want. If you sit at the bar the sushi chef closest to the front is abrupt, engaging, and hilariously inappropriate. The chefs love to cat call fine honeys that walk in. Loud and cool. You'll hear people having sake-bombs. Not AYCE. Gourmet rolls can be greasy. I have too many favorite rolls to list. Parking usually is a pain. Bring your white friends. They will feel comfortable because their brethren are primary clientele. Lots of things to look at so if you have nothing to say to your food companion it will not be weird. Be ready to wait forever for your check.

Now my favorite sushi place of all time.  I loved the lobster roll.  Just a whole lobster tail stuffed with a california roll.  How could you go wrong?  They have this weird divider thing going on at the door though, which was kind of weird.  This place was busy as well, so maybe call ahead for a reservation.  Everything was super fresh.  The  more prepared rolls also had a great taste.
I have been here several times and the only bad thing I can say is it is very noisy. Love this place and plan to go back many more times.
Good quality sushi! The rolls looked dull though, I wish the presentation was better! Otherwise a decent sushi restaurant with an authentic vibe to it!

This place is pretty cool inside.  It's pretty big but this place gets packed.  I never had to wait but I would call because it does get a lil kray kray.  They have nice private booths inside.  They welcome you by saying something in Japanese.  The sushi is fresh.   I had yellowtail and it was like butter.  The specialty rolls were ok but I am partial to regular sushi.  I came here last week for my first time and I have been back already.  The beer is 6 bucks for a large Kirin or Sapporo. This place was recommended to me by a local and now I recommend it to you.

The best Sushi place hands down in Vegas! May be the best overall Sushi Place anywhere in the country. Hard to beat this place.  This place is packed day in and day out - no matter the time or day. That speaks volumes of how much the locals love it.  The owner - James - is consistently in there every night making sure the place runs smooth and efficiently. Such a nice and friendly guy. He always takes care of my girlfriend and I whenever we eat here (we eat here a lot btw).   The Staff and Waitresses here are awesome and always on top of it with a smile on their face.  The sushi chefs are the best you can find!   Let's get down to why we come here - for the food!  The Sushi here is top of the line. The fish is of the highest quality and always fresh. Not to mention - the portions here are huge for a great price! The sashimi cuts are huge! The rolls are huge! They will even substitute for Brown Rice (which I always do)  The dinner menu items are really good if trying to do something other than sashimi or sushi rolls.   The rolls here are my favorite! The variety and selection of rolls is crazy - there are over 100 rolls! The rolls are huge! And not because they are full of rice like most sushi places - but because they are stacked with fish! These rolls will not disappoint.  A few of my favorites are: The James Special The Ryan's Special One Night Stand Kitchen Sink Something wrong 69 Spring Mountain Double D Screaming Orgasm Flower roll Stacy's Mom Las Vegas Roll I Love My Ass Lisa Hand Roll Bonzai Roll Monkey Roll   I have a lot of favorites - when I come here with my girlfriend, there is so much to choose from we usually end up ordering more than we can handle. Oh well :)

Without a doubt the best sushi place in Las Vegas. The ingredients are premium quality, and the rolls are all unique. The service is always amazing and the atmosphere makes it a great experience.  Highly recommended!!

I haven't been here in YEARS! The last time I was here was probably five years ago! I remember the sushi being SO freakin' AMAZING.  My friend and I came here for dinner with Hunnie Bunnie. She ordered the Udon noodles like usual and some edamame. No complaints from her.  We had the garlic edamame: pretty damn good! It could have used more sauce but the flavor was good and the edamame was cooked well.  We had nigiri sweet shrimp: this was SO good. The shrimp was VERY sweet and BIG and the shrimp heads were HUGE. Good stuff!  The only one I didn't care for (I even spit it out in my napkin) was the Garlic Tuna Nigiri. I'm not sure if it was the flavor or just the fish itself - it was kind of rubbery, hard to chew. YUCK.  The rest of it was QUITE good though, salmon, tuna, white fish, albacore, scallop, unagi nigiri.  It definitely wasn't as amazing as it was the first time I had it but nonetheless it was still GOOD.  Oh yeah and we tried one roll: Tiger Roll. It was aiight. There are SO many rolls listed on the sheet of paper you check off and I didn't see any explanations of what was inside of them. I've had a Tiger Roll before so I wanted to try it here, however this one definitely had different ingredients then ones I've had before.

The sushi was absolutely delicious.  My daughter treated me out to lunch and she spent $60 on three orders and one soda (a bit pricey), but it was good.  The reason it got three stars is that the sushi went right through us.  Not a good thing.  I would not eat here again only because the prices were pretty high.
Yummy! Loved the Salmon Lover & Screaming Orgasm :) Service was quick and it's totally worth the drive.

I am completely new to the world of sushi. I spent the first 34 years of my life avoiding it at all costs...and then...  The soy wrapper.  Game changer.  Wow.  So, once I found out about the amazing soy wrapper it changed everything for me. The seaweed wrapper is fishy to me, I didn't enjoy that. The soy wrapper is nothing, no taste, just keeps the rolls together. So now I'm able to try almost anything.   My favorite thing at I Love Sushi is the Tempura Roll. It comes with rice, avocado, cream cheese and then I substituted the eel for cooked shrimp. It's lightly battered with panko and flash fried then topped with eel sauce. It's so good. We usually get two of these because everyone always picks off my plate. My wife loves the Pho.  We always call and make a reservation. They host/hostesses always make me laugh because they make sure to remind me to be on time at least twice during the call. Reservations are key on the weekends because the waits can be relatively long.  Also, the service is always spot-on. Super friendly servers, very attentive, glass always full. They also check on you multiple times throughout the meal. Outstanding!

FOOD POISONING! I can't remember the last time I was throwing up so much and dealing with stomachaches and cold sweats. We ordered a few orders of sake nigiri and it smelled stale and not refrigerated. The service was great, but I'm in so much pain right now that I don't think I would go back again. Plenty of people recommended this place to me, but reading other reviews, it looks like I'm not the only one who got really sick. I would never recommend a restaurant where the chefs consistently get their guests sick.
Good sushi, overwhelming menu, great atmosphere, great service! Fun every time. :)

I definitely enjoyed it!! Everything tasted fresh, customer service was great, and the atmosphere was extremely inviting!! I'm not a sushi connoisseur, so it's a little difficult for me to evaluate!  I read the Yelp reviews and this was a top place to go! I'm definitely glad I listened. The Alligator Roll was my favorite. I tried the Screaming O based on everyone's suggestion; I wasn't the biggest fan. The Crunch Roll was a little plain for my taste.   I brought my girlfriend. I haven't been able to eat sushi for a few years because it's not her thing. So it felt great to make it here. They offer chicken teriyaki if you find yourself in the same predicament. So next time she says she wants teriyaki, we're going to I Love Sushi!! They have plenty of options aside from teriyaki (katsu, spicy chicken, etc.).    I'll definitely be back but I'll be trying other places to get to know my flavor profile for sushi!

Screw best sushi in Vegas. I'm calling it, right now..BEST sushi in the world. Sorry Jiro, you have your dreams AND three Michelin stars, I Love Sushi gets the "best sushi in the world" title. I've had sushi from the west coast to the east coast. I've had it in four different countries (Japan wasn't one of them) and I Love Sushi is the best.  I'm not even going to go into the simple stuff, like perfectly cooked edamame, or the gyoza that can be ordered steamed or fried, the cool ambiance or the super friendly staff. You can get all of that at any sushi/Japanese restaurant.  I'm going to talk about their raw fish. Clean, fresh, seasoned to perfection, beautifully sliced, raw fish. Each piece of fish sets on top of a well proportioned pillow of rice. One bite and your sushi world will be destroyed. Every other sushi joint will fail to live up to I Love Sushi. Sure, you'll try other joints, mix things up a bit, but the whole time you'll be thinking "man I wish I was at I Love Sushi".  Don't take it from me though. Go there and order a "screaming orgasm". It's tuna, ever-so-lightly seared, swimming in a pool of their in-house made ponzu sauce on a bed of shaved daikon. If that's not enough try the "something wrong 69" roll. I: shrimp tempura soft shell crab. O: more soft shell crab and five different types of raw fish. PLUS it's served with a side of their DELISH ponzu.  And to the people giving low stars based on chicken teriyaki, or that the screaming orgasm doesn't come with rice...animals don't deserve to die to be eaten by you. Just saying.

All I can say is, I Love Sushi ruined me from going anyplace else! I haven't found anything better. Kiss of Fire, Something 's Wrong # 15 & 69, and Pepper Tuna no rice all among my favorites. Service amazing as well.

I've eaten here many times over the past year and it is consistently delicious.  There's usually a 10-30 minute wait for dinner but no one seems to mind because the food is so good.  I recommend this place to anyone that asks for a good sushi place; even if they don't live in Henderson.
I LOVE I Love Sushi!  Every role that I've ever had there was amazing and also their prices are great.  I would tell anyone to check out this place.
Great quality fish.  I have been here about 10x and have always had a good experience.

Omg! I love sushi is fantastic.  Best  sushi place ever. I can't wait to go there next time. I have been going there for many years they are alway consistent whit quality and taste. My all time favorite there is crazy horse , Japanese lasagna

When you come here definitely try the Jackpot roll (crispy shrimp and salmon) as well as the Grand Canyon roll (this one has scallops and mushrooms). The Mochi ice cream dessert is a must! They offer you 4 different options of flavors. I selected Mango, Chocolate, Green tea and Red bean. I wasn't too impressed with the Green tea one so maybe get extra Chocolate or Mango, the Mango was awesome!! I love the vibe here and the customer service is great!!! Will definitely be back.

The seafood is fresh, the rolls are works of art, the servers are fast and friendly, the chefs are mesmerizing to watch, and they are always accommodating.  Service: The place is full nearly every single time I walk in, but they still manage to greet our party and get us seated as quickly as they can. We are offered pickled ginger, wasabi, edamame, and a cucumber salad within seconds. Drink orders are taken and delivered equally quickly. Our drinks are always full, our dishes are taken away as they are emptied leaving room for more dishes to arrive, and we are accommodated with special requests (my daughter loves vegetable rolls with only certain items and they are very nice about putting it together for her). We were even treated kindly when we had a shellfish allergy at the table; they made sushi and a roll on a separate area and were careful about serving it separately. Hot, damp towels are brought at the end of the meal, which is nice.  Meal: Orders are taken as often as you like (you can order piece by piece or all at once, they don't mind either way). Food is brought out fast, fresh, and beautifully presented. The chefs are so much fun to watch that I always try to either sit at the bar or seat myself facing them. I have literally NEVER had a piece of sushi, a roll, or any other dish that I didn't thoroughly enjoy. I always finish up with an oyster shooter because it's like a cherry on the sundae. *It's hard to say some of the names of the rolls to the server with a straight face, but I try anyway*  Price: Very reasonable for the quality of food offered. I gave it a $$$ simply because our party always orders drinks and a slew of fancy rolls. You do NOT have to spend that much to have a great experience.  Overall: I Love Sushi is on my shortlist of all time favorites. I spent my last 2 birthdays there and many a date night and family out night in between. I will be back!

But seriously. Five stars is what I have to give this place because well, it was friggin' tasty and the service was LEGIT as well!  We were seated at a table within 10 minutes of arriving without a reservation... And then we dove into the VERY CONFUSING MENU... While I totally would have taken a star off for the menu basically resembling hieroglyphics, the rolls we finally decided on were so good, I couldn't! What I would recommend is taking photos of ALL THE ROLLS so people can get a visual of what they're about to order- HIRE ME, and I'll do it! Ha!  Any who... Here's what I ordered (there was more ordered but I was so into making out with my own order, I didn't really pay attention!)  - Salmon Skin Handrolls (no rice, no sauce, no vegetables): This is a staple order for me, everywhere I go... If a sushi restaurant doesn't have Salmon skin, I don't go! I was VERY IMPRESSED with the portion they gave me-- typically restaurants aren't used to my type of order thus they're stingy with their salmon skin, but not this place! Oh and the skin was crunchy and pretty perfect!  - Hamachi Kama: this was a last minute decision and I'm really glad I did it because it was MOIST AND BOMB! I love the cabbage accompaniment (that doesn't have dressing) because I took bites of the meat and the cabbage together and YUM!!!   - Rock N Roll, Roll (no rice, no crab- wrapped in cucumber): this is legit what I wanted but I had to create the menu item-- as this one comes with sauce on top, rice, crab and it's wrapped in nori... But without blinking an eye, they made this roll possible and IM THRILLED cause yes please! The fish to cucumber ratio was PERFECT! And the fish was FRESH AS F!  - Seared Pepper Tuna with Avocado: I didn't order this but three plates were ordered for the table... And I'm glad I got to snag a piece, because it was SUPER TASTY! It would definitely be something I share with others though because I love Salmon 20x more than tuna!  Next time I come to Vegas, YEP- coming back here! It's not close to the strip and I'm 100% a-ok with that! When good food is on my radar, I don't care how far away it is from me!

This sushi place is amazing!   After living here two years we've thought about trying other sushi places, but we are always scared we won't find a place as good as this one!  John Holmes roll= amazing, Monkey Roll- hell yes, Ryan Special- yep it's delicious.  Everything they serve there is delicious and the restaurant is always clean and the staff is friendly.  Hardly ever a wait for a table and every trip has always been amazing. Basically I wish I had sushi right now as I write this review......
My family's go to sushi place. Cherry blossom is a guarantee must have. Everyone is always super nice and this place never disappoints.

AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME place!! I just can't say enough.   A buddy of mine who lives out here showed me one of two spots where the locals come for some incredible sushi without the outrageous price on the strip.   The interior is amazing.  I felt like I was transported back in time to a Japanese Tea House. I didn't realize how big it was.   I tried the Kiss of Fire (they warned me several times of how hot it was).  Incredible and very flavorful (Having a taste of the exotic and spicy), I didn't flinch.  My buddy had a couple rolls that I tried and I have to say it was damn good.  I can't say enough about this place.  Staff, Service, ambience.  Great place for a date.  Get out of the main casino strip and try the local spots if you can.  You'll save change and try some amazing rolls and Sashimi that's hard to beat.

Location, location, location.  Why the hell is this place so eff-ing far?!?!  JK, it's not THAT far.  Just far from me.  Truthfully I'm a sushi snob.  I feel that I have found the absolute best sushi place in Vegas, and I Love Sushi is not it.  The food wasn't bad though.  The tuna didn't look as fresh as I would have liked, so I chose to leave that part of my Hawaiian roll to my friend.  If he got sick, well it was his fault for dragging me there.   The Monkey Roll was pretty good.  That was really the only way I got out of feeling like I was cheating on my sushi place; by eating things on the menu that my joint didn't offer. Tried my first oyster shooter at I Love Sushi.  To quote myself the day that I tried it, "How is it possible that they took a lot of really really good things, put them together, and made them awful?"  Oyster on the half shell for me, please.  I did like how big it was and the kimonos that the hostess/waitress wore.  Very colorful.  Loved the sound of their flip-flops flippy-flopping.  One last thing....is there anyone else that felt like they were borderline dark-dining?  It's called a L-A-M-P.

I must have gone at the wrong time ;(  The first sign should have been the actual sign on front that said "help wanted".  Service was worse than any other sushi restaurant that I've ever tried. There were a total of four customers and two tables, us included and service was just horrible. As there were more employees than guest, kinda strange. Had to ask for help twice and took another ten minutes to get our order.  The garlic edamame was good but that was it.  I had the Baked Lobster and it was 95% mushroom and the little lobster they did give you wasn't even any good. Would not recommend.  Would definitely not recommend this place, clearly overhyped or I just caught them on a bad day.
Dynamite and Jackpot!!!!!! Sooooo good!  The food came soo quick and the servers are so nice! Love it here! Definitely coming back to try more food

*Rock N Roll-one of my all time favorite sushi rolls! Different types of fish sashimis rolled in soy paper and wrapped with a slice of cucumber. Soy paper was a substitution. I recommend this option because the soy paper is light in flavor, unlike the regular seaweed wrap which might take away from the freshness of the fish inside. This dish comes with five thinly sliced lemon slices. The lemon is for garnish but I definitely recommend eating it with your sushi. The acidity of the lemon paired up very nicely with the fish and leaves a refreshing palate craving for more. This dish only comes with 6 pieces! I wish I had ordered more. *Screaming Orgasm-comes in small and large options, sliced tuna atop of a huge bed of radish drowned in sauce. Tuna was drowning in the sauce; took away from the simplicity of the fish. This is a signature dish of the restaurant. Maybe I came on a bad day? Probably won't order the next time I come here. *Deep Fried Gyoza-I usually like my gyoza steamed then caramelized for some color and texture. But this one was too fried for my taste. Came with a side of gyoza dipping sauce. *Kiss of Fire-This dish was drenched in spicy sauce. I couldn't taste much of the contents within because the sauce was overpowering. Reminded us of a Mexican enchilada dish almost. If you do want to try this dish, ask for easy sauce. *Dancing Eel- We asked for easy sauce for this sushi roll since the Kiss of Fire roll was disappointing. The eel tasted fresh. Simple roll, nothing too special.   The decor and uniforms that the waitresses wore were very cultural. I loved every bit of it. The waitresses were super sweet and greeted everyone with a smile. They wear kimonos head to toe and have their hair in a traditional Japanese up-do. The service was excellent and they checked in with our table often to see if everything was okay and to refill our water cups.   I would definitely come back to visit again! I can't wait to try their other sushi rolls (they have plenty of variety which makes it very difficult to choose).

I love yelp.  I wish people would be stingier with the stars.  Four stars means I have nothing bad to say even if I do.  This place is great.  They have apps that are different for a sushi joint, specialty rolls that stand out and atmosphere that is cool, lit well and not so typical in the Japanese storefront feel.  The owner will occasionally don the Elvis garb which slays me.  This is a very good restaurant, a great place to turn a newbie on and it has sex appeal.
A great choice for Sushi. The product moves. The help is great and the prices are fair. I love the "Threesome" or the "Super white fish" don't hesitate to eat here.

This is the best sushi place I have ever eaten at! The place is always busy, which is a good sign! The staff is attentive and super polite and the quality of the fish is top notch. It isn't as cheap of some other places around town and they do not offer AYCE, but that doesn't matter because everything else is so amazing! The garlic tuna, Double D roll, and Johnny's roll were my favorites. They also offer warm sake and filtered or un-filtered sake, something for all sake lovers! Also, I recommend making a reservation if you are coming with 4 or more people, especially on Friday or Saturday night!
The best sushi by far not a bad roll in the house, only 10 min from  the strip..worth the trip, yummy

I have lived here 10 years and have always been told how great this place is, so tonight I had a chance to try it out and it did not disappoint!  The shishito pepper appetizer is delicious. Fantastic quality sashimi. The rolls are outstanding. We will be back.  Very soon.

Came for a late lunch on a Friday afternoon, around 1:30 and sat at the sushi bar.  The place wasn't busy at all, only four other parties seated in the whole restaurant.  There were three sushi chefs and four servers at the time.  Everything was prompt at first.  We received drinks quickly from the server and our first roll only took a few minutes.  The selection of sushi rolls was good, the food tasted good, but the service was flat awful after the first 15 minutes!   The only time the servers came by was to refill my drink (he had a large beer and a water, so his did not need refilling).  We were almost completely ignored otherwise.  One of our rolls was forgotten and our sushi chef disappeared (for about a half hour), and it was a good 15 minutes before we could get anyone's attention to find out about our roll, and service did not improve after their mistake was realized.    Furthermore, we wanted to order more drinks and dessert, but after waiting another 10 minutes for a server to come by, we just opted for the check instead.
Been eating here for over 10 years & never had a bad meal!  Sushi is always extremely fresh and so tasty!!!  It gets busy every night so go early if possible.

One of my favorite non-AYCE sushi places.  It's so close to my house!  The sushi is super fresh--it glistens, like it came straight out of the water, sliced up, and jumped right onto your plate! haha! When it comes to sashimi and nigiri, they give you thick, fresh cuts of fish.  This is the only place in the city that I've been to that has THE freshest tasting uni (if you have any suggestions otherwise, please comment ;)).  I could eat a million orders of their uni.   Service is cool.  The ambiance is casual.  I suggest sitting up at the sushi bar cuz those dudes are awesome.  I'm not gonna leave a super long review, because people have already raved about this place.  The rolls are great, appetizers are great--THE FOOD IS GREAT. LOL. Just go, you won't be disappointed.  It's worth the $$, especially if you enjoy good quality sushi.

One star is generous.Tempura dripping with oil . Smoked Salmon rolls are cooked.Fire roll  is deep fried without saying it is . Fire roll  cooked.  Nori wrapper very chewy . lost track  of rolls that were cooked but expected raw.  We had to ask 2 different  servers 3 times to stop cooking  the damn sushi.  √ùGrilled Eggplant soaking in oil.Tuna roll  looked like previously frozen,thawed pureed into some kind of red paste and stuffed in a wrapper which disintegrated like snow on a hot plate when in your mouth ....left half the rolls untouched hoping the next plate  would send a signal to redeem the previous one.No luck.The girls apologized but no compensation  on the 50 bill.presentation nice but that's it.Seaweed salad good but not for 50 shekels.  Something very wrong  here.

everytime we visit family in vegas we have to eat at i love sushi because we love sushi! the variety of rolls offered here is amazing. so on our last trip back we were super disappointed with the quality and portions. the nigiri was sad. tiny pieces of not so fresh fish and ok sushi rice. one of our faves- the screaming orgasm (who doesn't love one) was a big miss as well. the tuna was drowning in the spicy sauce. i've been there in the past and loved the rolls (hence the three stars) but it was pretty awful this last time as far as sushi freshness and quality goes.

I'm a recent transplant from California to Las Vegas.  I'm still trying to find the sushi place to replace my favorite in Lake Forest, CA.  I feel like once I find the rolls I like at I Love Sushi, this will be the place.. but I'm still searching.  I haven't settled on one I really like yet.  I am really not happy with the caliber of affordable sushi to be had in L.V.  (Of course the super pricey places on the strip like Nobu are amazing, but who can eat there once a week?) - All you can eat sushi is never as good a quality as regular a'la cart sushi. And every place I find here in L.V. is all you can eat!  It's something with the consistency of the rice and the quality of the fish.  I Love Sushi has quality fish.  Now if I can find one of their rolls that's similar to my favorite Jak Sal roll at my old Cali place I can finally settle down to a regular joint that I can visit weekly.

Our favourite nearby take-out sushi, although you can sit in and eat here, but it's got more of a snackbar ambiance.  We epecially like the nigiri special which is a good deal.  Good well-flavoured rice, generous portions of fish, very friendly service and inexpensive.  It's not super delicate authentic Japanese sushi but still delicious and straightforward, and the Vietnamese rolls with rice paper are interesting to try. The little chocolates at the end of the meal are a nice touch, very popular with my kids.

I hadn't eaten at I Love Sushi is quite a while, so I decided to try it again last night with 3 guests.  The environment is quite nice, even kimono-clad wait staff.  But, sorry to say, the food quality has really gone down hill.  And you do not want to eat sushi that is not excellent.  There is too much excellent competition in Henderson and Las Vegas to settle for mediocre.   I give it 3 stars only because of the attempt to create a nice Japanese environment, but I won't be going back anytime soon.

I really wanted to love this place. My boyfriend and I came here about a week ago because a family member had recommended it. I wouldn't say it was the best sushi I've ever had. We ordered a few rolls, a salad and octopus sashimi. I can't remember the crazy names of any of the rolls. (Not a fan of the names btw.) I ordered a steamed shrimp roll with avocado and eel sauce on top. He ordered a shrimp tempura, tuna roll of some sort with garlic sauce and another tuna and shrimp roll. The garlic sauce on his was very overpowering but the other two were tasty. We have other favorite sushi restaurants when visiting the Las Vegas area so we'll stick with them.

I  I love Sushi!  To be treated with such great service and great food, an all encompassing grand experience is divine and delightful.  Thank you for such a beautiful experience for my daughters 18th Birthday.

Love this place and I have been a regular since opening day.   I do go to other sushi bars to try out, but keep returning to I love sushi. Maybe its the way they immediately greet you when you walk in the door. Even if there is a wait, which there typical when we go on the weekends, its only 10 -15 minutes.   Our favorite - The screaming orgasm, seared ahi with a mayo and vinegar sauce on top of daikon radish! Yum.. the only difference I have seen over the years is the portion is getting smaller. The large order now looks like what the small did 4 years ago.   The bonzai roll is another favorite, shrimp tempura rolled into a california roll and drizzled with teryaki sauce. Spicy salmon another good choice along with the James Bond roll.   All this with a Sapporo beer makes for a great dinner out!   If you love sushi, this is a place to try. They have a huge selection, food tastes great and the service is fast!
Great sushi! One of my favorite places always busy!!! all my family goes there and love it! Great service, family friendly and very fresh fish!  U gotta love I love sushi!!!!!

Initially we had chosen to eat at this place solely based on Yelp reviews. I mean a place must be REALLY good if it rates 4.5 stars out of 5 correct?! Boy was I wrong.   When we first entered this place, I thought it was a pretty cool ambience. We entered on a Saturday afternoon and it was not busy at all. Waitresses greeted you with cute kumonos (sp?) on and cool Japanese music was playing in the background.  The first thing I noticed is that there is no AYCE here?! What the heck is up with that? And to top it off, one specialty sushi roll is average about $16.00 PER ROLL! A spicy ahi Hand roll was $6.25 per roll? You have got to be kidding me. Better be sprinkled with gold or something!  So quickly, my boyfriend and I decide on a lunch entree instead. Mind you, my boyfriend and Just came from the gym and expo so we are starving! We order 3 entrees for 2 of us and while we are ordering the third entree the waitress says something along the lines of "oi! More food?" I thought it was rude and then hilarious!  I did not get the waitresses name but she was probably the heaviest one there (just so that you can spot her, and not experience her rudeness.) Anyway, she delivers our 2 entrees and once she places my plate down she says "no more entree for you okay?" I had to kind of piece it together that she meant it was after 3 so no lunch special. She does not say anything about our third entree after like 10 minutes of not delivering it. So I proceed on asking her where it could possibly be and she rudely cuts me off and says "it's on the way!!"  After we are finished eating and she is cleaning our table she sees that I could not finish the tempura (2 onion tempura) and proceeds to tell me that I can request no onion next time! I cut her off and explain that I was full!   Horrible experience and to top it off, I got diarrhea after eating there! I'd rather eat at Sushi mon! They have all you can eat and not rude whatsoever.

To keep it short and sweet this place is amazing. I've never had a bad experience and I've probably been here 50 times. Anytime someone makes me go elsewhere for sushi it doesn't even come close to comparing to the quality and experience you receive at I Love Sushi. Everything is good so go ahead and order something you wouldn't normally go for. The rolls have funny names like Stacey's Mom and I Love My Ass...it's funny to hear the servers repeat it back to you. Yummy!

I really enjoyed the sushi here. Came for a bachelor party, and there were 5 of us. We had so much to eat and drink, we could've used a nap afterwards. Easily some of the best sushi I've ever had. 100% worth the drive!

Ate here for lunch over the weekend while visiting my parents. Cute abiance. Tons of different custom rolls. Great seaweed salad. Friendly waitstaff. My only complaint...I asked for water and the waitress brought me a glass of someone else's water that she refilled. She apologized profusely, and I don't feel sick, so that's good!  Located in strip mall kind of behind a Taco Bell. Would definitely visit again if in the area!
Best Sushi in Henderson and Las Vegas! Less rice more fish which is always fresh. Have never been disappointed with service and quality.
I tried different rolls, they were good. The food is Fresh and very tasty. I wasn't expecting this in Vegas...  Pretty busy place but staff is polite. Good place to eat.

Great food! I really liked this place..... What I did not like was how difficult it was to order! There are about 1000 different rolls on their menu, many of which only vary by 1 ingredient so you really have to sit there and read what each one is (since the names help you figure out nothing in regards to what's actually inside). The names of the rolls are really tiresome and stupid... No I don't want an orgasm/penis/vulva roll. Can't sushi joints just name their rolls what they are?? It took about 15 minutes to just read everything and actually figure out what direction to go in terms of ordering. Sadly, the waitress we had spoke very little English so she was of very little help in figuring it out.   All that being said I ended up ordering a dinner special with a few different rolls on the side (no sexy orgasms or weird sauce stuff, just basic sushi rolls and nigiri - eel, salmon, tuna). The fish was very fresh, the tempura was perfect and the chicken katsu was really good!   Definitely my new favorite place for sushi in the Henderson area.
Best sushi in Vegas. The Ryan's special and jackpot roll are the best! Super friendly staff as well.
Twas the night before Christmas, and all through the car, our tummies were grumbling. We couldn't go far. We jumped on to yelp to find some good eats.. long story short, this restaurant is sweet.

Here's the thing, I literally grew up here. Like, this place is about a mile from my house, and a block from where I went to high school and we'd walk here after school and get takeout (we were spoiled ok?!). We knew the sushi chefs by name, and when we got a little older (not old enough), we'd sneak sake bombs before going out to the coolest party ever. The inappropriate names for the rolls were the funniest thing we'd ever seen- it was the bees knees and the best sushi I'd ever had.   Fast forward 10 years, and sadly times have changed. The quality of the fish seems to have gone downhill and the cold fresh rolls just don't taste as fresh and the hot crunchy rolls are drenched in indistinguishable sauces. I really hate to say this, but last time I was here a few weeks ago, two of us got sick from eating the same roll. It's still a fun place to meet friends and get some so-so food, but now when we want a quality sushi dinner (it's all relative), we'll head down to Spicy Tuna.

Gooooood stuff. I am not from the area but read the reviews and said why not. I am glad my fellow yelp friends didn't steer me wrong. This place has some great names for their sushi but some really great sushi. Try the Mountain Roll or the I Love Sushi Roll. You wont regret  going here, even if you are away from strip drive here and enjoy. You'll thank me later.
Love this place, owner is amazing, fish is over the top great! Strongly suggest trying!

overpriced as hell. One thing that I quickly noticed from previous experience is that they keep the lights dim or practically no light at all. They gave me my plate and underneath it was so sticky and had some dried old food on top. I couldnt even eat, I left
I know you're supposed to get what you pay for but this is a whole new level. They actually used canned tuna in one of their rolls

Went for the dinner buffet and arrived around 5:30-6pm on a Saturday. We ordered way too much sushi that we couldn't finish. Shortly after feeling bloated, and looking at the amount of food we still had to finish, we asked them to cancel the upcoming orders that we had already placed. They didn't make a big deal about this. I really appreciate the fact that they charged us a mere $3 for the amount of food we left behind.  ;) we packed that in a takeout container to go.  The sashimi was fresh and all the beef appetizers I had were delicious. Beef roll with enoki, beef roll with green onion, spare ribs, bacon wrapped asparagus!! - You don't see that quite often. The mackerel was tasty too. I wish I had a chance to try some of the house special rolls. This is overall your typical sushi buffet.

I LOVE SUSHI SAYS IT ALL!!! I currently live in DC, but used to reside in Las Vegas, and fell in love with I Love Sushi. Screaming Orgasm is to die for! and "I hate my ex boyfriend" (or it might be girlfriend) is great as well. I love all the creative sushi's and names they are given. This joint is always on my mind, and I miss it soo much! I wish there was a "happy-go-lucky" sushi spot in DC like I Love Sushi.
#102 Sun Devin is a must! Other favorites #69 tiger roll, #81 Chris Special, #99 John Homes

This is my favorite sushi place in the valley. The freshness, quality, variety and service are unsurpassed. I've lived in Las Vegas for over 12 years and I keep coming back to I Love Sushi for the best Sushi experience. The focus is the on quality of food, not showmanship. It's in a small anonymous strip mall but it's worth coming to even if you live in the Northwest corner of the valley. You won't be disappointed.

I have been coming here for years but used to frequent another as well. I came in one day to find one of my favorite sushi chefs now here. I brought my family down for sushi on Friday and sat at sushi bar in front of my longtime friend Joe. We had the best sushi experience in years as Joe was giving us his spin on some of our favorites. My kids love sushi but we're talking about how it was the best sushi we ever had. I love sushi is great but having Joe there puts it over the top for me. There are some great sushi places in Vegas and this is by no means the only great place but people make a difference in the over all experience and everyone here is great.

One of our favorite go to places for Sushi. Great assortment of specialty rolls. I was there a few nights ago  and they had blue fin tuna as a specialty fish for the evening. We have always had good service.

This is always a great place for good quality sushi.  The lunch specials are a good value; comes with pickled sliced cucumber, edamame, choice of 2 main dishes, soup, salad, 2 pieces of vegetable gyoza, inari sushi, sweet egg and steamed rice.  The food is consistent and service is always good.
Best sushi spot in vegas, it's not all you can eat, but def worth the price per roll. Friendly and attentive wait staff, no complaints here, always fresh!

The best sushi place in Henderson.  They do not have all you can eat but that is because they use fresh raw fish and they do not use imitation crab. For the sushi lover this place is a must try. This is a hidden gem in town.

Absolutely delicious. I'm allergic to fish and shellfish but love Japanese food. This was definitely the place to go!  I took my 5 year old son here to try sushi for the first time. The staff was friendly and gave great recommendations for him. Soy paper wrapping is better than seaweed for kids. He loves the California rolls ( no mayo) and enjoyed the atmosphere.   I decided to get veggie tempura and habachi chicken ! It was perfection! The price was right and the service was great! It was an over all enjoyable experience! I'd go back again and again!!!!

I've tried several rolls from their special chefs menu and my favorites include the johny roll, James Bond and jackpot. The jackpot not as much anymore since it's a total project to fit each piece into my mouth. The johny is great if you like fresh, seafood and crunch - cucumber. The James Bond is basically the same but with rice. If you are kinda into sushi or on the fence you have to try I love sushi! If you really love sushi and can't get enough, you're doing a disservice to your life by not trying it.

We were in Vegas for business.  I had heard about this place a few months back so we decided to make the 15 minute drive to Henderson.  All of the rolls we ordered were delicious.  The sauces were also amazing.  But most impressive of all was the gentleman who was seating the guests.  He appeared to be the owner. We arrived around 7:30 and the place was packed. We asked for a booth. Even though the available booth was for 6 people (and it was just the 2 of us), he gave us the booth  - after I told him we had travelled from LA and had heard great things about this restaurant :) All the servers were attentive and super friendly.   Definitely will visit again the next time we are in town.  YUMMMMMY sushi!!  Recommend 'rock and roll', 'gary's special', one night stand' and the seaweed salad was also delishhhhh.   Thank you "I Love Sushi"!

This place is the bomb. The food is always amazing and the service is friendly. Only four stars because sometimes I feel like I'm being rushed, but I guess that's normal for a locals place that's good and busy.
This place has the best Sushi in town. There's usually a little bit of a wait on the weekends, but it's so worth it! My favorites: The Screaming Orgasm & the Japanese Lasagna!

Incredible sushi! Super fresh! Clean. Service was only okay. She was kinda rude and didn't seem like she could handle our order. Luckily the sushi was so good that we will go back but not because of the service.
Boom Boom took care of us again! Hands down...this is the spot for Sushi!!!  This place rules! Every person we tell to try it, loves it! The Uni tops it all!

Forgot to look this place up on Yelp before making a hungry, knee-jerk order with a couple friends.. but it was actually satisfactory.  Perfectly mediocre.. probably wouldn't order again, but not worthy of the 1-star reviews I'm seeing here.  I had only maki (party tray: 61 rolls for $44), so can't comment on anything else.  Bumped up to 3 stars because a) delivery to my downtown hotel was fast (and courteous) on a Friday night and b) they actually gave me extra ginger and wasabi as requested.

I love I love sushi.  I've taken out-of-town guests there 3 or 4 times, and all have left with little japanese food babies and big smiles.  You can miss it easily, as it's tucked into the back of a strip mall...with one tiny little sign to let you know where to turn.  But if you miss it, keep circling until you find it...it's worth it.  Consistently fresh sushi, and reasonable prices.  Great, dark wood decor, with serving staff in full traditional dress.  I always feel like I'm on a little fantastic voyage away from Vegas when I step in here.  Service isn't as great as some others in the valley, but the price is right, so I can cope with a little less butt-kissing.  One of my top sushi picks in the city.  Enjoy!

I ordered to go. while waiting for my order, they had me wait on their couch. I was surprised how busy they were. The waitresses wore kimonos (so cute), the waiters just regular black pants and white shirt. The restaurant was well decorated, booths on the side and tables in middle. I ordered some lobster rolls (i think it was little "¬†heavy¬†") and the Monkey roll (salmon, avocado, cream cheese, sesame seeds) it was very good forgot to mention the special sauce they put on the side so my sushi is not soggy. I enjoyed my monkey roll with some ginger! yum yum waitresses outfit are really entertaining. Since i was waiting for 20mns, I was looking at the staff running around, none of them had a smile on their face ...  The 2 girls at the entrance were a little "rude", when I came in I asked for the menu so i could order to go  and if they had any suggestion for some rolls with cream cheese and avocado. they looked at me and whispered something in front of my face, that was very rude... Ladies when you do, please be discrete... i went there yesterday night 01/06/18

Well, I guess if a place is called "I Love Sushi" I should stick with strictly sushi.  BUT, I was drawn to the "Tuna Poki" option on the menu, and I love poke (note the spelling difference).  I've learned since then that Korean "poki" is slightly different from Hawaiian "poke".  That doesn't mean it was bad - it just wasn't my thing.  So I suppose this is my warning to poke lovers.  I also had some salmon-avocado sushi.  That was good.  Not the best salmon I've ever had, but pretty good.  I sat at the sushi bar and service was outstanding.  It better be; there's like 16 guys running around behind the bar cutting fish, so whatever you order, you get it pretty quick.  I did get accidentally charged for a Mexican roll that the people next to me had ordered, but the mistake was fixed very quickly once I pointed it out.  Always check your bill, kids!  Some raw fish and a bomber bottle of Asahi and I was very happy by the time I left.

This place is has great environment and very friendly wait staff. All waitresses are dressed as geishas and are very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The rolls are a bit on the pricey side, but they do have a great variety and the fish is very fresh. The one down side is that they do not have ayce(all you can eat). With 14 bucks for a specialty roll it really adds up.

I do enjoy the more traditional sashimi and simple spicy tuna hand rolls - but there was something fun about reading the menu at I Love Sushi.  Makes ordering fun.  I loved that the waitresses wore traditional kimonos.  And the fancy rolls were delightful.

I stopped in after reading the reviews.  It was very crowded but easy to get in to.  Place was fun, and loud, but not too loud so you couldn't have a conversation.  Everyone just seemed to be having a great time.  One of the really nice things is they have plenty of staff to get your food out to you quickly and in and out in a timely manner.  I tried the screaming organism because of the reviews, it was really good and I loved the sauce.  I also tried the kiss of fire, but on the not so spicy side.  It was good as well.  This place was a nice find for a fun, quick sushi stop.

I live completely across town from I Love Sushi, but it is worth the drive. I stumbled upon this place through Yelp while I was in the area. Now I go out of my way to make it back whenever I can. It is completely al a carte, so be prepared to spend some money if you are very hungry.  It is worth it.

The absolute best Sushi hands down.   Excellent food and superior service.  I love the cucumber salad with fresh crab on top.   I  have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered.   You must try this place.  Always busy but minimal wait time.  Yummy
Best sushi in Town, freshest fish, best rolls. I come here for 2 ears, enjoy every time.

With names like stacys mom special and sex on the sushi how can you not love this place. The best thing on the menu was by far my ex wife :)   The entire atmosphere of this place was perfect for any group function. The folks that I went with were having a blast, between the Saki bombs and asahi super dry we were definitely causing a ruckus and no one seemed to mind. The sushi was fresh, so i had no concerns of internal battles with fish and seaweed.   I am definitely not a sushi person but i have to admit that being drug out to I Love Sushi and being forced to have a good time was by far one of the best decisions ever made for me. You gotta try this place.

Delicious rolls!  This place is a hustler.  They fill up quickly and the clear quickly.  The sushi chefs are sushi-making machines!  If you're on a time crunch to lunch, definitely come here.  You can have a 4 course meal in 30 minutes.  It's just a little on the pricy side...

The service is adiquit my family had enjoyed 3 rolls we had the spicy yellowtail sashimi 4/5 stars the sauce is amazing it really pops out in an amazingburst of flavor. We also enjoyed The Kiss Of Fire 3/5 stars it was good but it was quiet spicy and I'm not big on spice but it was quite good. Last but certainlynot least we had the Dancing EEL Roll I give it 4/5 stars it was exquisite it was a burst of flavor in so many ways the eel scause is great and I'm not a big fan of eel but it was sweet and had a amazing taste. I recommend this restaurant extremely for a family it was and amazing experience and can't wait to come agian I stand strong with my opinion.

With a name like this, I expected horrible food. However, my well-traveled sushi connoisseur buddy insisted on leaving the strip and driving off toward Henderson to the great little sushi dive. I call it a dive only due to the older, casual ambiance. The food and service were solid 5 star.  We overate ordering something like 12-14 rolls for 2 people. Additionally, we both had the sashimi salad. Many of the rools have too much mayonnaise or funky sauces. If you catch it upfront and request only brown rice, you can make this a healthy v hardy experience.  The sashimi salad is one of the most generous and best sashimi salads I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. I will definitely come back!

I'm a sushi fanatic. My boyfriend and I are always trying new places. I've been here a few times and it's literally the best sushi I've ever had. The quality is great and they have a lot of rolls to chose from. The only downfall is that they don't have an all you can eat option so it gets pretty pricy. The rolls are defiantly bigger in size and the presentation looks great so it makes up for it. Try the I love sushi special and burn your stomach roll. I would suggest making a reservation too because it gets PACKED on the weekends.

My first experience with I Love Sushi was just a few days ago and I CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK! My friend and I sat at the bar, and we were quickly taken care of. The sushi was amazing, the ambiance was so authentic, it's definitely a new favorite. Being new to the area I was searching and searching for a sushi place off the strip (I love RA sushi) and I've found it!

3.5 stars. Recommended by a co-worker. Not AYCE. Food overall a bit salty and slightly borderline on sauce overkill.  We tried two of their nigiri - halibut  and garlic tuna nigiri at around $4.25 each for two pieces. Fresh fish, but too much ponzu.  We ordered two cut rolls. The spicy tuna roll was quite spicy but delicious. So was the eel roll.   Tried the lunch special. You can choose two entrees and it comes with salad, miso soup, inari, tamago, chicken gyoza and steamed rice. We ordered the chicken katsu (cut into six pieces and breaded just right) and salmon teriyaki ($1 extra).  We also ordered three specialty rolls: screaming orgasm, something gone wrong #7, and taste like my x-girlfriend. The screaming orgasm had no sushi rice at all but was very good. Halfway through though, the sauce became too much, especially if you eat the shredded radish under the fish---it sucked up all the sauce. The taste like my x-girlfriend was delicious but also too much sauce. The best was something gone wrong #7. So so good. It also comes in a dipping sauce, but is perfectly yummy without it.  Add in two hot green teas and I was $81 lighter after our meal. I'd come back again, but request less sauce. Ample parking in the plaza lot.
Always amazing! This place is packed and rightfully so! I love the cherry blossom and the screaming "o." One of my favorite sushi places!

Combining two of the best cuisines can't be at all bad, can it? I dropped into this place for lunch while looking for a simple sushi place. I didn't realise that they were a combined place until I looked at the menu, which was Japanese for Page 1 and Thai for Page 2.  It is pretty standard fare, a selection of 2 rolls with soup and salad for their sushi bar special. They also have a sushi lunch special which comes with sushi, tempura, gyoza, rice and salad combinations. I was disappointed to note that they do not have chicken kaarage though.  The Thai selection is more of the classics like Basil Chicken or Beef and Pad Thai. It looks to be fairly average, even though the sign on the door indicates some kind of accreditation as "Bangkok Paradise Authentic Thai Cuisine".  The sushi I got was reasonable. The rolls were cut into 6 rounds, but both the salmon and avocado roll and the unagi and cucumber roll I had, included only a frugal amount of filling in them. Nothing to complain about but smaller than other sushi places I've been to. It did work well into my plan for a light lunch though.

Very high quality ingredients with great service. The atmosphere is fun if you sit at the bar, intimate if you sit in a booth, or great for families or parties at a table. My husband and I love this place. They will custom make anything, also.  Sake bomb, anyone? :-)

The best sushi in town. Atmosphere, service and sushi were all 5 stars. Our server was the best. Our drinks were always filled, food came out presented beautifully. Our friends from out of town were happy we went here. Even my friend from out of town said it was some of the best sushi he's had. Their appetizers are great too! The place was packed, but we were able to get seated within minutes.

Another favorite! Once you've had sushi here, you'll have trouble loving other places as much. Don't get me wrong, I do like other sushi restaurants, but this is our favorite. Even our friends & family from out of town, always want to go there when they visit. Try the Pepper Tuna. If you like pot stickers, get the spicy ponzu sauce to use as dip. The spicy edamame is great too! The service is good & prices are reasonable too. Enjoy!
Omg this place is soooo good I will defiantly be back Joe is awesome so kind and kid friendly
This place is amazing! Best sushi in town. On top of having the best sushi they are so kind and treat you with the up most respect while you are there. Sushi and costumer survive is on point.
One of my favorite sushi spots in Vegas, always amazing, great sushi, the fish is fresh, I'm a fan! It's certainly in my rotation for Vegas sushi
Excellent sushi!!!  The wait staff and ambience are great as well. The Vegas special (#54) is great. Can't go wrong with some tall Sapporos either.

This is where I broke my Las Vegas sushi cherry... TMI?  After a long day of driving a U-Haul across the CA/NV stateline, lifting and unpacking boxes I was ready to eat, but I was sick of fast-food and pizza options. I yelped Sushi and this place popped up with 4 1/2 stars? Let's do this!   I placed an order for pick-up and they said it would take about ten minutes. Hmmm, ten minutes for 2 orders of Udon Tempura and 2 Caterpillar Rolls? I decided to test this and arrived 8 minutes & 25 seconds later. "Hi, order for Tiffany?" (my GF) "Yup, right here...two orders of Udon Tempura and 2 Caterpillar Rolls"...whoa, this place is on it, but how does it taste?  I brought it home and feasted. The Udon Tempura was very good and full of flavor. The tempura was delightful, not to greasy just lite and flaky. Poi-fect! The Caterpillar rolls you could tell were super fresh and delicious. These were definitely made to order.   This place gets an easy 4 stars. I'm coming back to get the full restaurant experience soon. Maybe this will lead to an updated review and a added star?

I Love Sushi is hands down my favorite sushi spot in Henderson (and I have been to them all).  The service is always incredible prompt and friendly and sushi is incredible.  The #22 flower roll and #28 jackpot roll are the best on the menu and mindblowingly good.    The only con is that they don't offer "all you can eat" and I am a huge eater but the quality and atmosphere make up for this.  I HIGHLY recommend giving I Love Sushi a try!
The restaurant itself is just ok.  Nothing fancy.  Food was alright.  Not sure if I would be back again.  However, I will say that our waitress was very nice.

√áa y est, je viens de trouver mon nouveau restaurant √† sushis.  Vendredi. Il √©tait 21h. Je n'avais pas encore mang√©, et l'envie de prendre des sushis fut imm√©diate.  I Love Sushi (Rue Saint-Denis, non loin de l'intersection Rue Rachel Est) est, comme son nom l'indique, un restaurant √† sushis.  L'int√©rieur n'a vraiment rien d'exceptionnel, mais ce n'est pas le d√©cor qui me d√©range personnellement. D'ailleurs, il y a une petite terrasse ext√©rieure qui n'est pas pour me d√©plaire : bien pour y manger durant l'√©t√©. Mais parlons plus des sushis.  Vous avez plusieurs choix qui s'offrent √† vous : des makis/sashimis/sushis aux compositions originales, √† la carte (par 5 ou 6 il me semble), ou bien les menus du chef ("menus express") avec diverses compositions. √Ä noter que ces derniers sont moins chers le midi que le soir. √Ä ce propos, question prix, c'est vraiment tr√®s abordable : comptez 8$ pour le menu le moins cher (sans la boisson et le dessert). Je crois que le plus cher co√ªte dans les 24$, mais vous avez plus de sushis :)  Le temps de pr√©paration n'est pas si long que √ßa : √† chaque commande, j'avais attendu 5 √† 6 minutes, ce qui est vraiment rapide. On vous fournit wasabi, sauce soja et gingembre bien entendu.  Pour ce qui est de la qualit√©, c'est correct, voire tr√®s correct. Chaque bouch√©e est un d√©lice, le temps de bien savourer votre plat : le succ√®s est toujours au rendez-vous. √Ä la fin, vous avez le ventre bien rempli !  Le restaurant est tenu par un couple vietnamien super sympa, ils me rappellent m√™me mes parents. Et c'est toujours un plaisir d'aller manger/commander l√†-bas.  Pas cher, rapide et avec une bonne qualit√©, c'est pour moi le bon plan √† ne pas rater ! Pas le meilleur restaurant sushis, mais pour un √©tudiant comme moi, c'est le fun.  Petit plus : vous pouvez t√©l√©phoner √† l'avance pour commander, le temps qu'ils pr√©parent votre menu. Une fois arriv√© au restaurant, il ne vous restera plus qu'√† payer.

Love this place! Super fast and attentive service, especially when you're seated at the sushi bar. The specialty rolls are amazing and diverse and the names just crack me up. Definitely not for the conservative, I think they'd be offended by names like "tastes like my ex girlfriend" and "I love my ass". Creative rolls, fast service, good prices, really friendly staff. Its a place I would go to 3 times a week if my income allowed it! Someday I will have tried everything on the menu.

These people do not love sushi. Ordered delivery. Took 1.5 hours. It arrived cold. They told me 40 minutes. The free soup was good. The free salad was edible. Everything else was the worst I've ever eaten. Really really bad. Yikes!

From start to finish everything about my experience here was average.  Greeted at the door by a host that may have been a robot. Service was nothing special. Sushi rolls were big but very plain to me. The Joe roll was dry, I ate one piece and left it. Prices were high for an off strip restaurant with no wow factor. We came here because they have great reviews, maybe we caught them on a bad night.

I'm sad to say I hated it, ate 2 sushi and little else.  I ordered a chicken udon, a combo sushi and a specialty - they forgot one sushi, not that it mattered -- everything was essentially inedible.  Udon was greasy, with little taste and slimy looking, the sushi was grey and had a weird flavor.  I was hoping for the best but spent $50 including tip, for hoping I wouldn't be ill.

After several tries my famly convinced me to try sushi so I did.  Six of us went to I LOVE SUSHI to celebrate my grandson's 20th birthday.  He's been a fan of sushi since he was 7 so who am I to argue?  LOL.    I'm hooked.  We ordered 10 different items and just layed them on the table smorgasbord style.  Wow.   The Japanese Lasagna is great but I would recommend sharing it cuz it's very rich as was the Orange Bowl, no rice - excellent! .  I particularly like the Mistake roll, D.C. Roll, Franky's special  and the Yum Yum Roll.  Everything was terrific but those were my favorites. Had something called Joe's Special and Johhnie's Special roll and like them as well.   I especially like the cucumber salad they served as we sat down.  My younger grandson doesn't eat sushi but ordered a plate of Pot Stickers and loved them.    I have nothing to compare this place to foodwise but I know that everything I tried was excellent and very well prepared.   Had to bring home a couple of containers of their pickled ginger and the wasabi is REALLY over the top good.   The service was great but I have to admit we got there early in the evening.   The ambience is Japanese right down to the kimoni type dress the waitresses were wearing.  Gave a nice touch to the whole ethnic scene.    My  highly experienced sushi loving friends are happy that I'll be joining them from now on and they recommend I Love Sushi also.   Gotta go with the flow on this one.

I give 5 + starts for the food, i always say i won't comeback because of the service, but then i go to other sushi place in town i  regret not going to i love sushi.The waitress were OK, everything was served on time and fast.  For the service i give 1 star just because of the owner /manager in the front. I felt like Seinfeld's episode when they go to this awesome soup place, but the chef is horrible and they can no tell him anything because he won't sell them food anymore!  He has no customer service sense, i hate seeing the sushi bar staff getting yell at! come on! they cook a great sushi! don't humiliate them in front of your costumers!. And what is worse! i just was telling him i was waiting for my friends and he got mad at me! aghh!!  i love the sushi but i don't agree with that manager's customer service.
Going through town,  and stopped in.  Good food,  and there lettuce hand wrap is delicious

Horrible experience  I am new to sushi and I was treated so bad   Any question I had a recommendation they would not give me and they gave me the cold shoulder most the time. literally had asked a couple next to me for a recommendation. I did not feel welcome nor did I feel like I should be there. This is not a place that I will ever return to     It seemed Like I was more of a nuisance than a customer. I could be in middle of chewing my food and my plate was taken away from me       I ordered multiple orders of salmon belly and decided to order a beer. At that point I was asked is that the only thing you're going to order a seven belly over and over? Who cares I asked questions about what sushi you have and I told Jose knew that you are obviously upset that I'm ordering the same thing which I know is safe. O   I will not recommend this place to anybody nor will I ever be back.   I work in the food industry, I serve people day in and day out. I've been doing it for over 20 years and the way that I was treated and the service I was given I don't recommend anybody.
Best. Sushi. Ever. Prices are good and the food is wonderful! I've never had a bad experience!!!

been coming here for years.. always packed amazing amazing amazing! I drive 5 hours just to eat here get the lisa handroll its bomb! the only thing I don't like is they hav over 200 rolls so its anxiety sitting trying to read all of them figuring out what to get.. this is the best sushi in all of Nevada :)

So many amazing choices here! The menu is huge! My favorite was the Kitchen Sink, but everything I tried was amazing. Super fresh and good prices too.  We sat at the sushi bar and all the sushi came out super quick. All the staff was very friendly, efficient and attentive.  I Love Sushi is officially on my list of "must eat at" places in Vegas.

This place is one of the best sushi places here in the Vegas area.  Each sushi roll and every bit of nigiri is prepared with care and made to look beautiful.  The prices are standard for sushi, and not too expensive, though of course not something you can get every day in good conscience.    The service is good.  I've eaten several times at different times in the day, and the waitresses are always polite and prompt.  They're a little subdued in early afternoon, but they're quite nice at dinner times.  The atmosphere varies, but not at all badly.  In the lunch times and early evenings, when there isn't as many people, they're a quiet, pretty restaurant that you'd take someone for a chat while you eat, whereas when you are at dinner, especially on a Friday or Saturday, they're full and very noisy.  Why noisy?  Because the sushi chefs are busy being fun and crazy and flirty (with women) and sometimes randomly offer free drinks and shots of things, and if not, then they're being bought drinks by the appreciative customers.  But the service is always good.  The quality of the fish has never let me down.  Even on Sunday nights, when most sushi places are at the other end of freshness, I Love Sushi seems to chug along as usual, and some of the dishes just can't be matched anywhere.    I always eat Dynamite at sushi places, and theirs was quite good, if not the best in the entire world.  I'd say it'd be great to order if you're there, but not worth a special trip.  Overall, I love coming here when I have extra cash on hand.  My only complaint is that it doesn't have an all-you-can-eat option, which I suppose would make the service level fall, the quality diminish, and the presentation falter.  But I eat a lot of sushi :/
Busy Busy but Fast service....I like how the waitress were kimonos !! Yummy sushi and bento box a lot of food for a good price...nice atmosphere

Mmmmmmmmmmm.  I miss having a large variety of sushi restaurants and rolls.   My kindred spirit took us to her favorite sushi joint in LV and I must say, it's delish.  They had so many rolls I could barely finish reading the list before our waitress came by to take our order.  The fish was fresh, the sauces were creative, and the custom rolls were executed wonderfully.  You will need to try the Kiss of Fire roll which is a combination of spicy fishes drenched in some spicy sauce then topped with a dot of sriacha and a jalapeno.  So good...Most importantly, the prices are wonderful.
The food is great, and the staff is very friendly. I recommend this place to all sushi lovers.

In Vegas for Superbowl weekend, wanted to find the best sushi in town. I think I was successful, this is a very good sushi spot...the chefs were polite, service was fast and extremely courteous. The servers are lovely looking in traditional Japanese garments. The ambiance was done right as well. I ordered the Boom Boom nipple special and the Dragon roll. Both were delicious and I'm planning on going back for some of the other menu options before I leave Vegas. Highly recommend this spot to all who are looking for good food away from the stop.

Actually we are fan of sashimi and sushi . So we came to i love sushi and expect to get really fresh fish and unique sushi . But over all on the menu most are sushi roll .so we try a hand roll , sashimi . Which is ok . And unagi don came with good portion but eel little too sweet and have some bone which is you have to careful litle bit while you eat . And yellow tail collar was very disappointment because the fish was old and taste not impression . ( made me got diarrhea later that night ) . For the service for out table i guess the waiter not really attentive . After he took an order he came back a couple time to asked again that what we order . We took not too long to finish our dinner before we leave we have one lady to seem like she attention but just right before we get a check .

Style over substance. Poor saki selection. Lots of crazy rolls with hip names.  It is a chore to get a nice nigiri off the menu. Meh.   Sloppy preparation. The rice just falls apart.   This place is popular so maybe it was good at one time. But it has jumped the shark if you ask me ;(

Wow great sushi place in Henderson. Been here twice in two days! I'm traveling from out of town but am glad I found a nice healthy high quality place to eat while I'm here. Love the peppered tuna avocado dish!
By far the best sushi off the strip!  Very friendly service too.

This place is so weird & good at the same time. I was in Toronto for work and stumbled across this ridiculously cheap sushi/thai AYCE. I was intrigued and went it. Sure enough, you get two menus, a sushi menu and a thai restaurant menu. You basically get to order whatever you want for a flat fee. Be warned, the thai portions are relatively large. I did 2 rounds and then felt really bad about a 3rd because it was so cheap. I didn't want to singlehandedly put them out of business.   I liked their thai soup with chicken the best. And the salmon sashimi wasn't bad!  Definitely check it out.
Great sushi outside of the strip!!!! My wife and and I LOVE SUSHI. We tired the Jackpot, and Last Call.  Amazing!!!!!  Will be going back.

In a city where a sushi joint dots every single corner I love sushi is a true standout. The variety of rolls and sushi is unmatched by sushi joints in Las Vegas. Sitting at the sushi bar is always a good time. The sushi the chefs can do saki bombs with you and feel like part of your party.  Although they don't offer "all you can eat" like most places in town, I love sushi doesn't need to run promotions like that and the place is always packed. The service and food make people come back time and time again. Check it out be sure to try the MC roll, Japanese lasagna and the screaming orgasm.

This place was delicious.  The dining room is pretty large and was packed.  My friend informed me that it was packed every time she has been there, but we were still seated immediately.  The waitresses are dressed and Gieshas which was really cool.  The food was amazing, and I highly recommend the Sushi Nachos.  They were delicious.  Will definitely be making it my regular spot.
The Best Sushi in the entire valley. Very friendly and helpful I learned how to order sushi here.

What is all the hype about this place. Agreed, it's packed with people. However, a sushi roll is just a roll. If your looking for true sashimi then this is not the place. Their bento and udon is..eh. Had much better many other places.   You really can't tell how fresh the fish is because it's covered with ponzu sauce or some kind of sauce. If you like that, go for it! If you are truly looking for traditional Japanese, not the place.  Service is good. Atmosphere is loud.

This I Love Sushi . . .this is good stuff. It's a bit of a trek, especially from the center of Las Vegas, but after two visits here I can say it is worth it. Who would have thought there would be so many sushi restaurants out this way, but many there are and thanks to a recommendation from a local in the know we found I Love Sushi.   I'm not a sushi expert but I can tell when the food is fresh and of excellent quality. Next time you're in a sushi restaurant order some Uni. It's a good way to gauge the quality of the food. I Love Sushi's Uni scores well.  Sitting at the bar, I thought the sushi chefs were professional, friendly, entertaining, funny and good at what they do which is to make great looking and tasty sushi.  The service was very attentive, almost too much so, but that could be attributed to the fact that this restaurant actually reads their Yelp reviews and realized that people have previously made comments about their iffy service.   Here are two dishes I've had and really liked, the Caterpillar Roll - tempura shrimp, cucumber, eel topped with avocado and eel sauce; and the Dragon Roll - California roll topped with eel and eel sauce. Both were fresh, fresh, fresh.

This is my go to Sushi / Japanese food. I have eaten there soooo many times and have no bad experiences. The selections are plentiful and delicious.  With the amount of people that eat there, the selection is always fresh.   Best Sushi in town! Something for everyone.
Yum - order off the menu rather than from the train. They have a killer poke bowl if you choose rice instead of noodles and it is so fresh and tasty that I lay awake at night craving it!
The sushi here was amazing! Probably the best sushi I've had. The owner, James is extremely hospitable and friendly. 5 star experience!
Love this place with my wife. Coming 2 times monthly. Monkey roll and Jackpot special is the best ones we like

We've been a few times now and enjoy the food very much.  Service can be a little slow as they are quite busy - but that happens.  Spicy Tuna - down the road has essentially the same menu and they're half as busy.  My feeling is the rolls are a cut above...and the service is better.

Great sushi.  I'm pretty picky about my sushi and this place is probably one of the best in Vegas.  I also find the owner to be rather amusing, although maybe his employees don't appreciate his heavy involvement so much.  :)  But he seems to genuinely want customers to have a good experience.  The food itself is amazing.  it's always busy, best to make a reservation.  But if not, we have never had to wait too long for a table.

Went here based on a suggestion of a nearby business.  The service was very good, the wait staff is very attentive and our server suggested a delicious coconut sake that we loved.  Now the bad part:  the sushi tasted fresh enough, their menu is too big to parse out, and they wanted to start taking our orders immediately.  Everything is a la carte, no AYCE.  I did not love a single item of the 4-5 rolls we ordered.  We tried a sushi nacho thing that was too sweet, the sauces were either spicy and runny or poorly described on the menu.  Every item was just a little OFF.  The worst part comes today as my boyfriend and I have been sick all morning with GI distress after visiting.  I walked out last night disappointed and I woke up beyond angry that now I can't travel today because I'm locked in my bathroom.  Update: I called the restaurant the next day and a manager got back to me 4 days later.  They were very kind and apologetic, I chose a refund of my money instead of a credit at the restaurant.  I'm glad they offer this sort of service.

I enjoyed the atmosphere, service, food and the servers. I especially enjoy the authentic japanese robes the ladies wear on their shifts.   Fish is not that fresh. Ex: cuts of fish was VERY VERY COLD/icy-like, as if it was recently thawed out from being frozen.   I enjoy authentic foods and was in the mood for ebi (live shrimp.) They said they have it, but it is frozen. Hands down, without hesitation I passed on this. (Just an FYI.)  Recommend: * "Bam bam" * Oyster shooters - yet the oysters are small. * Ginjo - cold sake. Very tasty and smooth.  Pass: *Cucumber wrapped rolls, items listed without rice. They skimp on the  quantity/portion of the fillers for the rolls if you order it this way. A great disappointment. * Sashimi - magaro. Only came with 4 very small pieces. Not worth it.   Overall, the food was good. I would go again.
Amazing sushi. Probably the best me and my wife ever tried. Guys are great out there,especially Aron and Randy. Best sushi guys ever. Super friendly.  A+

First time I walked in to I Love Sushi was about four years ago and the sushi chefs yelled "James Dean, hi James Dean!" at me. Now, I've been called a lot of things in my life, mostly Macauley Culkin, but I have NEVER been called James Dean for the indisputable fact that I plain and simple don't look like the Rebel Without A Cause.
