However, after doing a few shooters and sake bombs with the chefs, I truly did feel like Dean and we joked and joked about it until I walked to my car and let someone else drive so I didn't actually end up like the late actor (faceplanted into the pavement.)  Joking aside, this sushi is the best in town. I've never been disappointed by a visit and every time I try something new and have a new favorite roll. Some of my favorite menu items include the Bonzai Roll and the Yellowtail Sashimi. The flavors of each are top notch and so fresh.   Lunch specials are very affordable and include a buttload of food. Stop reading this already and go find out why we all love I Love Sushi!

This place has been a must ever time we are in Vegas.  15 minutes from the strip out in Henderson which works well since we have friends that live out that way.  We have never been disappointed and the pricing is amazing compared to other Sushi places we've been around the country.  Half the fun is reading the chef's special menu with all the crazy roll names.  We definitely have our favorites like Kiss of Fire, the classic Rainbow Roll, and Crunch Roll but have to try a few exotics every time.  This trip was the Boom Boom Nipple Special, very good and became the war cry for the weekend.  LOL  Trust me and give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.  My only suggestion would be shorter glasses for Saki Bombs instead of the mugs they use, but that's not a big deal.

When in Henderson/Vegas, this sushi joint is hands down the best there is.  Some of the names can't be written or repeated here (when you see the menu, you will understand) but I had two different ones that were killer.    Tip:  Ask for the Natto Hand Roll.  It's not on menu but you know you have a authentic Japanese Sushi Bar when they have Natto.  Cash and Credit Cards accepted.

I have tried several places here in Henderson and one one impressed me, I Love Sushi :)  Try the Jerry Roll or any of the sashimi or sushi...All Very fresh.  And their service is definitely 5 stars too.
Best sushi in town. Great service, food and price. Highly recommended to everyone . Great atmosphere too

We've been here several times . And just last the other night with a group of friends . And our two little ones. Under one years old .Service was excellent and the food is amazing !   Went again last night . This time our service was terrible . Our waitress was annoying and terrible made a comment saying she thought I gained weight from the last time she saw me !!!! Rude !!! Lady I'm 4 months pregnant!! Keep your thoughts to yourself and be professional. Last time we came out waitress made our dining experience wonderful . My 10 month old .. I order her a miso soup and ask for lots of extra tofu . As it is soft for her to eat and she loves it ! Last  night I asked the same thing and the waitress that was annoying said , I did put tofu ! When there was barely any !Uhhhh I won't be coming back because she's been our waitress everytime we go ! Mind you she not a very attractive lady herself . And shouldn't be commenting about a pregnant girls weight ! Over priced and not worth the bad service.

i always have a good time at i love sushi.. i walk in everyone is so friendly while you are getting seated at the same time. i usually ask for a table rather than the bar. fast service good sushi! well i get the crunch roll with soy paper, extra eel sauce or a chicken teriyaki roll with soy paper & of course a side of eel sauce!! i also get some mango mochi after. i leave satisfied every time so what's better than that!
I love this place. Every time they deliver the goods. 100% of the time we are in Vegas we come here. No ifs, ands, or buts

You can tell a great sushi spot when they don't have an all you can eat option. Fresh rolls and great apps. Hands down my favorite sushi in town. A little far up Eastern Ave but it is worth the trip. Huge sushi roll menu. My two favorites are the Jackpot and Crispy Rice roll.

Do you like lukewarm miso soup?!  If you do, pick up that phone and dial I Love Sushi.  I ordered from this place online (Just Eat) and it took an hour and a half for my food to come.  Like, had I known, I woulda walked over to the McDonald's around the corner.  When the food got here I chugged the miso soup then tried the teriyaki beef.  It was okay.  Dehydrated from the commute.  The california roll wasn't good nor was the entire experience.  I was so hungry, I wasn't even hungry no mo!    I love sushi, but I don't love these carelessness at "I love sushi"   2 stars cuz you didn't completely wreck the steamed rice.

I'll be honest, this is not the best Japanese restaurant in the area. But I come here more often than the other restaurant for  couple of reasons.  The place is lively and fun. It's busy, has a good buzz going, and the service is always good. The waiters are efficient, friendly and precise. Some of the women are career waiters and know how to work a table with humor. My favorite waiter is great with kids and engages in small talk without taking time away from her other tables.  Portions are big. This is white man's Japanese food. One "John Holmes" sushi roll for $12 is a meal. An order of tuna sashimi is bigger than anywhere I've ever been.  Food is consistent. You won't find toro, shima-aji, or kanpachi sushi here. That's not what their clientele wants. But the rolls are creative. I know what to expect and I've found items on the menu I'm comfortable ordering time and time again.    If you have friends that are rather middle-of-the-road, and not very adventurous, you can bring them here to introduce them to sushi. They'd also have plenty of meat and other cooked dishes to choose from.
By far the best. Sushi. I've. Ever. Eaten. I have nothing else to say but put this app down and go there now.
Delicious! Speedy Friendly  Highly recommend this place   Alligator and Lobster rolls were fantastic

Convenient location from my home with decent prices. I had the jackpot roll, monkey roll, and the spicy tuna roll. My favorite bar far was the jackpot roll. Of course anything with tempura is amazing but this one really stuck out as the bell of the ball of flavor. Service was prompt and friendly as well, even on a bustling Saturday night! Think I will give a few of the other rolls a try on my next Vist and the plum sake was probably the best sake I have ever tasted for less then 100 bucks a bottle.

I picked this restaurant to eat because of the ratings.  I promise to never eat there again, nor will I recommend it to anyone.  I will agree that the service is fast. I was there on 3/03/2016.   It is almost as if they want their customers to get in and out again as quickly as possible so more people can come to eat.  The tuna poki was way too spicy.  Even my hubby who likes a little spicy did not like it.  It was too hot for him.  They took away my cucumbers before I had finished them.  They did not bring wasabi or ginger to the table...I had to flag someone down to get it.  My rainbow roll tasted fishy.  It was so bad I didn't finish it.  I would have liked to discuss this with someone, but nobody ever came back to our table.  The green tea was scalding hot, too hot to drink.  By the time my first cup had cooled enough to drink, I was done eating.  As we left the restaurant, I mentioned going out the door that I did not like the rainbow roll, which in turn was said to me I should have mentioned it earlier.  Well, I would have liked to mention it earlier, but nobody ever came back to our table.  I got tired of waiting.  The food isn't worth the price, the hot tea too hot to drink and the follow-up service non-existent.  I won't recommend this restaurant, nor will I ever eat there again.  At least I didn't throw up what little I ate of the rainbow roll.  For an $85 tab for 2 people, the food and service should have been much better.

My absolute favorite non-AYCE sushi place.  Sitting at the sushi bar is always fun as the sushi chefs are very friendly and interactive.  They always start you off with a cold cucumber dish.  Yum!  As silly as this sounds, I had the best California roll I've ever had here!  I recently tried the Grand Canyon roll which was phenomenal.  A hidden gem for sure!  The ambiance is so comfortable.  You can sit at your own private table or out in the open.  The restaurant is always busy!  I'm always excited to try something new when I come here.  A must try if you are a sushi lover! :)

Hands down my entire families favorite sushi restaurant! We are regulars here and every time we leave completely satisfied. Our favorite rolls are Kiss of Fire, Bam Bam, DD, and Jackpot Special. Other menu items we love is their Screaming O, Pepper Tuna, chicken salad (very flavorful), jalape√±o yellowtail sashimi, and spicy edamame.

My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas! My friends and I go here once a week - sometimes twice! Always sit at the sushi bar! The staff is fast, attentive, welcoming, and love to interact with the customers!   Food - They have 116 rolls on their menu, so you are bound to find something you like. They have rolls without rice if you are trying to be healthy, and deep friend rolls of you are feeling crazy. My favorites are the salmon lovers, the boom boom nipple special, and the fat ass special. The fish is always fresh, and I have never had a bad experience.   Sake - We have never done official sake bombs, only the shots. They have 5 different flavors, and they are strong!   Definitely worth the stop! BEST SUSHI IN VEGAS!!!
This Place is on point.  Best Sushi and service in Las Vegas/Henderson.  You will not be disappointed!

Fantastic place. Great food. The quality of fish is very fresh. Great vibe too. The sushi chefs in center are very friendly and funny. There is always a line outside at certain times. I loved the followin sushi dishes: dynamite, pepper tuna no rice , spicy tuna , crazy horse , Japanese lasagna. I cant wait to go there again. Heard its been here for years.

This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas, they really nailed it here.  Their American style sushi is prepared in front of you if you are sitting at the bar, which I recommend for a fun social experience. The staff is highly entertaining, serving double-duty as chef and social ring-leader they are somehow always successful at getting my group to participate in a round of saki bombs.   The chefs recommendations are always a good direction to go. Their service is fast but they don't rush you, allowing for a fun dinner experience whether you're out with a group or on a date.   The decor is cheesy and perfect. It can use an update, but if they do I fear the environment would change, so I do not recommend that they change a single thing.  If you are a sushi snob, this might not be the place for you, and we probably wouldn't want you hanging around us anyway. But if you are looking for yummy food and a consistently great time, I Love Sushi is your place.

I've had a really hard time finding a good sushi spot in Vegas. Too be honest freaks me out a bit (we don't have an ocean lol) but I heard this place from a friend so I went to try it out. It was amazing! Really fresh fish and awesome rolls. There is an older man who is so cute he owns the place and he is there everyday. He seats you and checks on your through your meal. The staff wears kimonos and look very traditional, the place looks "crowded" at first but you warm up to its cozy vibe. I ordered albacore sushi and a baked lobster roll, so good. They are really good with food preferences and allergies too, I'm allergic to mushrooms and my roll had it in it so they made it without them. My sister had the mountain roll and it comes in a little pyramid and it has salmon and crab! This place is now my go to for sushi!
My favorite sushi in Las Vegas. Hilarious menu names, delicious food, great service!

The first thing I noticed about this restaurant when we drove into the lot was how big the sign was and then how big the restaurant was.  It's a big place and I highly recommend it for big groups!  They even have big booth like sections for parties of 6.  FOOD: Kiss of Fire ($13): Spicy crab, tempura shrimp, cucumber, soft shell crab, albacore & jalapeno topped with extra spicy ponzu sauce.  I tasted more lemon than anything else in this roll.  Maybe it should've said "extra lemony ponzu sauce" on the menu instead.  I Love Sushi Special ($11.50): Spicy tuna & cucumber topped with tuna & spicy special sauce.  This was probably my favorite roll of the night! They were very generous with the tuna.  It's got a kick but it's bearable.  Crazy Horse Roll ($8): Smoked salmon, cream cheese, avocado, green onion & deep fried with eel sauce.  This is an excellent choice for those who don't like raw fish.  It's creamy and sweet!  Fat Ass Special ($13): Tuna, salmon, yellowtail, white tuna, crab meat, avocado, deep fried panko, spicy mayo, hot sauce & eel sauce.  My friends & I giggled when they repeated our order and when they brought it out: "Here is the fat ass".  HAHAHA!  This is a wide roll so you can't actually get all the fish in one bite.  Without dipping your roll in the surrounding sauce, it wouldn't be too spicy but if you drench it, you'll feel a good kick.  Green Tempura Ice Cream: They swirled the bottom of the bowl with chocolate syrup.  The tempura was more cake like than crispy but that's up to the restaurant's choice really.  The green tea ice cream was actually a little bland.  RECOMMENDED FOR: ROLL LOVERS!  Don't get all food critic-like on this place because this ain't the time.  Enjoy a long list of out-of-the-box rolls, crazy names & lots of sauce!

I used to love this place. I went with my wife sat down started reading the menu, got up walked out. The staff asked me why I was leaving and I said the menu is offensive. Items like the John Holmes Roll, Threesome, Tastes like my ex girlfriend and others (many). I just had to say when. The acceptable level of disgust has reached the point where public places accept this as standard. Not me not anymore.

The past 2-3 times we have been to I Love Sushi, we feel as if it's gone downhill.  The service has been terrible.  The food & rolls were not as fresh as usual and just plain blah.  I am very disappointed...  Help, we need a new sushi home!

My wife and I eat here a lot, but I have to say my favorite experience was watching a Monday Night Football game. I watched a few guys get absolutely trashed on sake bombs while eating at the sushi bar. Oh, and the food is really good too!

This was easily one of the best sushi places I've been to. I love how unique their menu is. You can't go wrong with anything you order. I will definitely be coming back when I'm in town. It's well worth leave the strip to eat here.

This place has some really good sushi, however it would be cool if it was all you can eat (I drove from summerlin bc of all the hype and I didn't even check if it was AYCE)....but it wasn't a big deal at all! Overall had a great time here and the staff is very friendly! Will definitely stop by here again!

Delish! Fun! Love the food, great sushi chefs. Been ere on dates, been her with fam and everyone leaves happy. A little pricy but great sushi is. Hear from a friend there's a kitchen sink roll that excellent. I haven't had it yet but will on my next visit. Bon Appetite!

Don't know why this place has so many great reviews, Gyoza was terrible!!! Smelled terrible!!! We ordered three rolls that were very mushy and did not taste good.. We asked the chef to make us a roll based on what we liked and it was the worse roll of them all... Will never come back again.. Pushy staff and very rude when we said we did not like something.  If you want good Sushi go to Sen Of Japan off DI and Durango.

Tried giving I Love Sushi another chance, and left less than impressed. Off to a bad start with the crumpled paper napkin with a couple of specs of blood on it, as if somebody has squeezed a pimple. Ugh ! Well, here's the beer with a nicely frozen mug. Next was the Tuna Tartar with Salmon (!) and avocado, which was easily the highlight of the event. Unfortunately, it was downhill from there. The tempura shrimp in our first two rolls was tough and chewy, as if it had been fried a while ago. The other rolls were rather bland and forgettable. Would have been 3 stars with a clean napkin.
Favorite sushi restaurant in town. Good service and fish always fresh.  Plan on a wait Friday and Saturday night.
I love it   Good Service ,inexpensive  Spicy sushi  my favorite  Always full it worth the wait time  Very tasty

I love sushi, but not so sure if I love it here.  There are many pros to this place, but here's why I thought it was just A-OK.  Walking in, you're greeted and waited by waitresses/servers dressed in kimonos (cute).  It was busy going to lunch on Saturday, but there was plenty of seating.    We decided to sit at the sushi bar.  I'm not exactly a fan of sitting at a low sushi bar where I have to look up to talk to the sushi chefs.  It's just awkward.    Tuna Karai, Candy Cane Roll, and the super white tuna nigiri (ono) are what we ordered.   The Tuna Karai:  $16.50 for a bowl.  You can go to Sumo Sushi and get a Tuna Karai for $14.00 and double the amount.  This was good, but not $16.50 good.    I love softshell crab, and I'm glad that I Love Sushi has a variety of sushi rolls that include softshell crab.  I decided to try the Candy Cane Roll.  There wasn't any sauce on it.  The flavor was just okay.  It had a weird after taste to it.  It was also a bit too salty too.  Just a weird flavor.    The super white tuna nigiri (ono) was probably my favorite.  They give you a generous amount of ono sushi.  Great with a piece of wasabi and soy sauce.    Maybe I'll come back and give this place another chance in the future, but for now, it was just okay.

My friend took me here while I visited her.  I saw a lot of raves for this place but in my experience, I thought it was ok. The service wasn't great and the food was overpriced for what we were getting.  I think I got used to sushi-mon in vegas which has great quality sushi for a great price as well!!  Maybe I came on an off night!!!  Who knows, maybe I'll come back and try it again.
Never been to the restaurant, but get food delivered from here frequently. Always fresh and tasty, and prices are reasonable.

This place was just a random pick because I was craving sushi. Thank goodness I took a chance on this place. My new favorite sushi spot!!! Service was super fast and the ambience was very traditional Japanese. I ordered the Dynamite Roll and my sister ordered the Jackpot Roll, and both were hands down, AMEEEEEEZING!!! I highly recommend this place and cannot wait to come back and try the Fat Ass Roll!
Amazing sushi, soup, dumpling, atmosphere and service. Def will return and recommend to friends.

The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because it's a good 15-20 minute drive from the strip and it's in a lousy strip mall (which shouldn't count against them, but for ambiance and setting, it does).  Other than that, the sushi is excellent and the prices are awesome. Talk to any local in Las Vegas and they all love this place.

Sushi was average, I was pretty excited after seeing the reviews, but it isn't anything special. The cheapest roll I got ended up being better than their more expensive rolls. The pot stickers were pretty good, but the sauce they came with...not so much.
The food and service has always been great here. Just started going again after being out of town and still love it.

This is one of my favorite sushi spots and it's right by my work which is amazing. The staff is so nice and sweet. The food I've never been disappointed it's always so fresh and good. I love the rainbow roll and all the salmon rolls just incredible. I always recommend this place to my clients and friends for a delicious sushi spot.
This place has always had the best sushi ever. Fish is fresh, food is great and the service is wonderful. If you love sushi, this is the place to go !!!

This is the sushi place my friend takes me to whenever I'm in Las Vegas for a visit. On each occassion I've sat at the bar and the service has always been excellent and the quality of the fish has always been very good. They are prompt in making the sushi and the wait staff immediately clears the plate once you've finished. There is almost a factory like quality to the service in terms of efficiency. Although I haven't personally experienced, but my friend tells me that this "efficiency" also makes this place a bit undesireable if you just want to sit at a table and have a leisurely dinner. If your table finishes their plates and are just hanging out, it's almost guranteed that they will be politely asked to allow the wait staff to clear the table for a following reservation.
This place is so delicious. Their sushi is always so fresh and the service is amazing. All the servers are so friendly. This is my favorite sushi place out here so far :) will be coming back a lot.
Def my #1 place for sushi. The atmosphere is great, the staff is awesome and the food is always on point.

Busy place on a friday night. cool interior-- although I think their attempt to look authentic comes across as a bit campy. Still, good sushi place.  Sit right at the bar and you'll get instant service. We never had a problem getting our orders to us in timely fashion. The Screaming orgasm was probably the tastiest of the specialty rolls we had. The meat was arranged in a poke like fashion over tasty crispy noodles and tangy sauce. I agree with a previous critic that they rely on sauce a little too much here, but it is tasty nonetheless. The jerry roll went down smoothly, and the crunch roll can be addicting. Dynamite was very filling and a good value pick ( if you don't mind baked rolls). For those who don't know, it's a mixture of scallop and chopped shrimp baked over rice soaked in a creamy sauce. They offer a huge selection of specialty rolls here but they also do nigiri. The yellowtail was very thick-- some of the biggest pieces of nigiri i've ever seen. The squid was as well. You don't have to go AYCE to get a good value here, especially if you're willing to try a number of their nigiri offerings.  We left quite full, and I would gladly return.

im gonna give a bump here because my lunch on Friday of assorted sashimi was decadent...  maybe it was a fresh order, or maybe its like this all the time?  who knows, but everything was delicious and of excellent quality...  for reference, just basic sashimi orders...  tuna, salmon, albacore, yellowtail, and white fish...  had a piece of a spider roll and it too was also very yummy...  maybe it was the Kirin Light, maybe it was just getting off the road after a 4 hour sojourn to Sin City from LA, but id recommend I Love Sushi to those looking for decent dead fish off the beaten path.

I love this restaurant, they are so quick! Always making sure if we need anything else, excellent customer service and the cooks made me feel very welcoming and the servers are amazingly polite. I recommend anybody to go and try out the food, I love this place. It's also very dark and feels comfortable to eat and they have big wide booths I love it!

The sushi is great but order the ROLLEY RICE BOWL..... It will blow your mind.  The jackpot roll with cream cheese added is amazing as is most of the rolls but the ROLLEY rice bowl is a MUST. I have never seen a dish like this in any other sushi place.

This korean sushi bar is located a good distance from the strip and caters to locals, especially those who want to drink and have a great time.  Be sure to take care of your staff of chefs here (seriously, I think there were 8 of them) with beer and they'll reciprocate generously.  I really just come here to hang out and drink with a local LV friend of mine and not really to eat.  However, I've learned the sashimi is the better way to go here as they give you generous amounts of it and is pretty good.  I suggest the albacore tataki or the yellowtail.  Make friends and have a great time....but be sure to have a designated driver or take a taxi if you plan to drink heavy here as it's pretty far back to the strip.

The best sushi I have ever had in Las Vegas. For that reason when we purchased a house, we were glad to know we were moving closer to I Love Sushi. The owner is always in there, working so hard and really helps facilitate the movement and feeling of the place. There's not a big turn around with the sushi chefs or employees. Always a good sign. We have become regulars

Well done sushi! The place is clean and was not busy on a Saturday night! Good cheese wonton, dinner they have California salad very taste! Overall good place to eat and I was impressed with the variety of sushi! They have one which the roll is a cucumber, very different I liked!

There are plenty of details about specific dishes/rolls in the previous reviews so I'll keep this succinct by saying this is probably one of the top 5 sushi places we've ever been too. It is not a traditional sushi house, per se, but the food is fun, the combination of flavors are delicious and it's a nice indulgence. If you're a sushi snob with an iron rod up your asshole this is not the place for you, but if you are chill enough to enjoy good food you'll love I Love Sushi.

Nondescript strip mall, go inside and love the Japanese themed decor. Waitresses wear the garb too. I don't know how they work in those dang shoes tho!  The burn your stomach roll was awesome, definately my fave. The salmon sashimi was really good as well.  The menu item names were entertaining.

Being that this is Las Vegas, I wasn't expecting a whole lot from the sushi restaurant. But I love sushi turned out to be a great find. The atmosphere was traditional Japanese, the service was excellent, and the sushi was very fresh. Each dish was prepared with great care and presented beautifully. The only Reason I didn't give this five stars is because they were a little heavy-handed on the sauce which covered up from the freshness of the sushi itself.

Talk about "under-rated"! This place was great! Probably going to come back tomorrow for breakfast! The Crunchy Roll was good. Didn't find the California Roll right away on the menu so just asked for it! Chef knew what I wanted and it was fabulous! I am such a traditionalist!
Absolutely delish!!!!  If you go over the weekend be prepared a bit of a wait.  I am a huge sushi fan and this place rates top for me!!!

My husband and I are kind of obsessed with the AYCE deal at one particular sushi place in town so we kind of had to force ourselves to try something new. We decided on I Love Sushi thanks to the great reviews!  We went for lunch so it was pretty quiet and our food came out pretty quickly. They have a HUGE menu with lots of unique specialty rolls. We had one that was drenched in a garlic butter sauce which was absolutely horrible for us but tasted delicious.  We tried some plain nigiri and I was pleased by the quality and freshness of the fish- it was pretty fantastic. But the price was a bit high for everything we got and since I am a mega sushi pig, I want to eat a lot of sushi! Still, the interesting menu selection would be enough to bring me back for lunch or something in the future.

Great sushi always fresh and tasting good. Staff is very nice and super helpful. The cook is very knowledgeable and always recommended stuff that I ended up liking. Prices are fair for the area. There are several sushi places in this part of town and this is the best palace I have tried. Super clean and hours and good.

The service here is on point. I was checked on pretty often, but not so often that it was obnoxious. Maybe because I was a pretty girl, sitting by herself at the sushi bar (forever alone).. haha I kid.   I decided to treat myself to some sushi after a nice evening walk by MacDonald Highlands. I was supposed to eat whatever I wanted as my cheat meal for a really restrictive high protein, essentially no carbs, diet. I ended up ordering seared tuna that was served with half an avocado and marinated red onions... essentially not what I was supposed to do. But man, it was really good. A++ would order again.

Eric- sushi chef gave me the most delicious screaming organism :)  He made sure I was happy with the service , my meal and my visit.  Its nice to get individual attention when you sit at the sushi bar alone. Its not so lonely after all. I frequent often and this place is just a hit!

Wow this place was a let down. Service was extremely slow. Everything from getting our order in, getting our food, and getting the bill took way too long. The server checked on our table only once.  They don't have AYCE as an option. The rolls were priced higher than most places, but the rolls were a little bigger.   I ordered the D.C. roll and the Happy Ending roll. They were ok, nothing that made me say "omg this is so good" more like "eh, I've had better" haha. The D.C. roll had soft shell crab in it, which is my favorite thing, but I did not like it in this roll. It left a burnt flavor in the roll like it was fried for too long. If you order this roll I also do not recommend pouring all of the special sauce on it at one time. I made that mistake and it was just too much for the roll. The Happy Ending also had a lot going on, they burnt the soft shell crab in this roll too. It was good, but I think next time I would stick to a regular Japanese lasagna roll.  I was in the area and wanted to give it a try because of the reviews... but im very picky about my sushi places so I don't see myself coming back here.

Went here for dinner on a Friday night. I've been eating a lot of sushi lately and couldn't resist trying out another place. I have to say that this place was interesting because the waitresses actually wear kimonos and have accents. My server was pretty sassy which made things even more enjoyable lol. I tried the Ryan's roll which was pretty good. It reminded me of a standard crunchy roll, but this one cost like $15, so I don't know if I would get it again. The Screaming Orgasm was really good too and the small portion was only $10. The seared tuna was good and I would probably get it again. I liked it because it was fresh (not like some places with the chewy or stale looking fish), had a slightly spicy aftertaste, and had a bunch of sprouts and stuff which made me feel healthy. It was pretty busy so you know that is a good sign.
Fairly good sushi spot ..especially for lunch in the area servers are nice and place is pretty clean .I recommend it for lunch .
We had the special garlic shrimp dish. It was amazing. The sushi was very fresh and delicious and the service was great ...very attentive. We have a new favorite sushi place to go now!
Bam Bam roll and shishito peppers were perfect. Love this little spot when Im in Vegas. Great service too!

Wife and I have ate here multiple times. Never disappoints. It's moderately priced, however, it is the best sushi within the area. If you sit at the bar, try to get a seat by Simon. He's one of the sushi chefs (Itamae) and he makes the entire experience real fun.   Go-to rolls: Monkey Roll I love sushi Kitchen Sink Garlic butter special  It gets real busy during the weekends...make that reservation ahead of time.

(Brown rice sushi) I love I love sushi even though this place is packed on weekends!! It's worth the wait. I am trying to be health conscious when I can be so I love that they can make sushi with brown rice. I don't know any other sushi joint in Henderson or Vegas that can make sushi with brown rice. Their fish is always fresh tasting. The waitresses are nice. Sometimes I get a little rude attitude when it's super busy, but it's OK. If someone know other good places that can make brown rice, please let me know.

Holy cow. I was recently given a Zagat Book and was taking a trip to Vegas so I figured why not check out a reasonable priced Zagat rated restaurant. This place has made me a believer of Zagat. First the service is incredible. They are attentive, fast (but not too fast), and overall professional. The decor was super cute with the waitresses wearing kimonos and authentic attire. But that's all fine and dandy. The food. The sushi. Holy cow. So good. We got...  Tastes like my ex girlfriend  Double d's Bam bam The kitchen sink Burn your stomach   The kitchen sink was my favorite but they were all incredible. We probably go to sushi twice a month and are always trying different places but this is hands down the best sushi I've ever had and for an incredible price as well!! Next time we are in Vegas we will definitely be going back!!
This is probably one of the best sushi restaurants I have ever been to.  Great service, amazing food and the selection is outstanding. Great if you love sushi or even looking to expand your horizon.

TERRIBLE SERVICE!!! Two times, too many! We waited an hour after ordering 4 rolls and 2 box dinners an and a shooter. Our kids box dinners came out and no rolls, the waitress kept apologizing, but no resolution. We finally cut our losses and left, $60 bucks short without food for us.  We talked to the manager, just "sorry" "sorry". BTW- the table next to us sat down after us, ordered, eat and paid in this time. Whatever the situation, at the very least we shouldn't of had to ask for the manager and they should have taken care of part of the bill. The sushi there is good at best, but nothing to write home about or is worth putting up with such terrible service.

One of the best sushi restaurants in all of Vegas. The menu is a never ending choice of creativity and flavor. Sake selection is one of the best off strip. A bit pricey but worth treating yourself. Note they don't have AYCE.

This might be some of the best sushi I've had so far in the Valley.  I had the crunch and monkey roll.  Amazingly good as was the other items I sampled at our table.   The menu is extensive as our the portions.  No AYCE option but I didn't think the price was bad for what you get.  My only complaint is that they don't have a spot closer to me!

Amazing service! The tuna tataki salad is my fav but there is a huge variety of fancy rolls as well as more traditional fare. I have also had great take-out experiences from here as well (fast and carefully packaged).

Just a quick review: For solid sushi, this place is great. They don't participate in AYCE, like most local spots do--this is the place you want to go to for a fun, energetic environment and very good quality fish! The service has always been spot on and the dishes are great. Being that sushi can get very pricey, I typically order one of the Entree's and a couple rolls, to share. The Entree's are very reasonably priced and they bring you a lot of food. My favorite roll is the Joe's Special! A MUST!!!!
This is by far the best Sushi in town. The service is great and the pricing is perfect.
This place is awesome.  Food is unique and delicious. The service is awesome.    We will be back here soon.
Delish ... amazing options. .. highly recommend the screaming orgasm! very authentic, waitress dressed in kimonos & hot towels delivered on arrival :)

edwin is the best sushi chef this place is the best sushi place i've ever been too ..the screaming orgasm  is so yummy it's seared tuna with sum yummy sauce love this place ..  love the sushi chef EDWIN...

If you've been patronizing this restaurant since 2010 like I have. You have probably noticed lately that the waitstaff are incredibly rude and the sushi is not as good. That's because ownership was sold 4-5 months ago. This place has gone completely downhill. Won't be going back.

I've been coming here for over two years now and it's always consistent. You can find me here once a week usually Saturday nights. A couple of our favorites are Sexy Time, Double D, Frankie Special and Gary Special. Try it, you won't be disappointed!
I can't believe I'm the first to review this place... Silly name - Awesome sushi, gets crowded at dinner time... Lots of exotic rolls available, but they nail the basics.. Best I've found in Vegas...

My husband and I just had our first date here since our 7 month old baby was born. Service was awesome! Food really wonderful. We started with cucumber salads and miso soups. We also shared a spicy tuna roll that I'm craving seven days later!! I ordered the salmon skin salad that took a little longer than my husband's meals, but it was worth the wait!  It was larger than I had anticipated, so I ended up not ordering anything else after that. We plan to return as soon as our relatives return to babysit our baby girl!

We went to this place because Spoon & Fork was full. It was pretty good. They had around 200 items and they were different and good. You have to get the Spicy Shrimp, and the Raman. Oh yes only All you can eat Sushi place that also gave you a good variety of Ramen noodles

I have been to several sushi spots all around Vegas and around the country and this is my absolute favorite place to eat sushi. I like to do all you can eat but sadly this place doesn not offer AYCE  suchi so it can get pretty expensive. If you ever go I recommend you try the screaming orgasm... you wont regret it.
The sushi here is delicious, there are many different selections and they're all SO GOOD!! the only thing that sucks baaaad is the service.

Hands down my favorite sushi spot in town. The sashimi is fresh and the service is great. My only tip is that they tend to over sauce some of their rolls so it's a good idea to ask for the sauce on the side.

I stumbled upon I Love Sushi when I punched in my postal code in orderit.ca for delivery in my area. I do love sushi, so I decided to try this place.   The rice in the rolls was mushy, causing the rolls to fall apart easily. The beef teriyaki was very dry, I mean where's the teriyaki?!  After my first order from orderit.ca, I gave I Love Sushi another chance by calling in my order. On their menu, they state $15 or more for free delivery. I had some difficulty placing my order over the phone due to language barrier and was charged for delivery even though I ordered more than $15 worth of food.   In addition, upon inspection on the Dinesafe Toronto website (which I should have done before ordering), I discovered that I Love Sushi has received Conditional Passes (yellow) twice in the last year and a half by Dinesafe.   Needless to say, I will not be ordering from them again.

I Love...My Ass, Screaming Orgasms, Honey Rolls, and so much more.  The screaming orgasm is a gateway to serious sushi addictions. For the virgins out there, it's seared ahi tuna served on a bed of shredded radish and topped with a ponzu sauce. If you're burnt out on orgasms, try the spicy, crispy rice plate, under "fried rolls."   The spicy tuna and crab mixes are so good that I suggest you try them straight up in hand rolls, which are gigantor. If you're not afraid to swap saliva, buddy up on these. But do not cut them in half. I repeat, do not cut hand rolls in half. That would be like lobbing the head off of a Virgin Mary figurine.   For dessert, get the honey roll. Somehow this fried salmon roll tastes better than custard.  On top of all the sexy names and delicious sauces, the waitresses wear kimonos and repeat your order with humor, "So, you want I love my ass?" Yes, yes I do.

What can we say... I LOVE Sushi is our refuge at the  of the week! If we miss a week, we feel out of sorts! Why??? Because the service & food is top Notch! Best chefs & ladies in waiting!   Your constant companion,  ~deirdra

Definitely tasty, but not worth 5 stars in my opinion. They have a LOT of sushi roll items (about 100+) but in my opinion, that's WAY too many. It always takes me forever to go through the menu and after awhile, all the rolls sound the same.   Service is good and the sushi chefs are nice, but the menu is a bit overwhelming.

I've been going to I Love Sushi for awhile, it's always been my favorite but today was a different story. We don't get to indulge on sushi often, it's a treat when we're able to afford to go eat sushi. Today my husband and I were excited to go to our spot to get some sushi, sadly it was the worst I've had in a long while.. my salmon was SUPER fishy and even my california roll was fishy, how does that even happen? My husband wasn't as displeased with his roll or his yellowtail, but it definitely wasn't on par with our previous visits. I don't know if it was an off day or if this place is going down hill. To be completely honest, we probably won't be back. They don't offer AYCE so everything is a bit pricey, in my opinion if you're not going to offer AYCE you need to make sure your fish is fresh. Can I also mention it was a Saturday? Wouldn't you expect the weekend the fish would be the most fresh because of how much traffic they get on a weekend? I won't be recommending I Love Sushi anymore :(
Love this place!!! They burst my sushi cherry and I've been addicted ever since! The screaming orgasm is amazing and the green tea tempura ice cream is great!!!

Amazing!!  Upon arriving in Vegas, our family brought us here for the "best sushi ever".  Could this be true? We were soon to find out!  The restaurant was crowded, very lively, and luckily we had a reservation so we got right in.   Our cousin is pretty much a sushi snob, so he ordered all our entrees. We started out with saki to salute our dining adventure. First on the menu was the Screaming O (seared tuna with mayonnaise sauce on a bed of radish). It was pure delight!!  I highly recommend it! Next we had garlic albacore & garlic tuna. Both fantastic. Next up Kiss of Fire and Who's Your Daddy (both on the spicy side). They were definitely crowd pleasers. Last entree was The Grand Canyon Roll - a great finish to the meal.  Everything was very fresh, good temperature contrast and great presentation.   We discovered that they had Green Tea Tempura ice cream and we were full but just couldn't resist. We devoured it!!  We had a great experience and it stands up to the hype!! It's no joke!

Love this place!! The food is SUPERB!! Staff is friendly and it's always filled with familiar faces who go back to eat there on a regular basis!! I love restaurants that serve great food and feel like home!! I Love Sushi is that place!!

Love it. It's fishy in all the right ways  I'm a little biased here because I met my now fianc√©e here. But personally I have eaten at many sushi places and this one is definitely one of the better ones. The fish tasted fresh, I never had to ask for water refills and the atmosphere was pleasant.

The restaurant looks old, the service was really bad, the girl even served us salmon without soya sauce, everything tastes like leftover. My friend said it just because i read the reviews and i was obsessed with those, but no, it was actually the worst sushi i have ever had. When my friend was paying he was about to pay $2 for tips despite the fact that everything was so bad, but no option for "amount", just by percent, 15, 25 or 30% in total. Such a horrible place, i dont want to be mean, but sometimes we cant get what we pay especially in this case. If i can rate it 0 star, i would love to do it.

This is by far my favorite sushi joint in town.  Holy yum just thinking about it makes me hungry.  First of all if you go to I love sushi and don't order the Lisa handroll you're crazy because it is cone shaped heaven, like I could probably just eat those for the rest of my life!! Anywhooo I also enjoy their Double D roll and screaming orgasm appetizer,  not to mention they have ridiculously fresh sashimi.  They do not have AYCE which is kind of a bummer but everythings very high quality so I get it (Sushi Mon had delicious AYCE)  It get super busy though so I would suggest making a reservation.  Also their waitresses have always been very sweet and attentive I don't think I've ever had a bad experience there.. happy eating!

My husband and I moved to Vegas 4 months ago from FL. We have been searching for sushi like this since we lived on the west coast of FL! We lived on the east coast of FL for 9 years and we had a sushi joint that we loved. They served a spicy crab roll, which is NOT a complicated roll but we have not been able to find a single sushi place that served this roll in 2 years. . .until we went to I Love Sushi last night! This place is our new go to sushi joint. We had the Jackpot Special, spicy crab roll and eel and tuna sushi. The red tuna filets were as fresh and yummy as you can get. The rolls were fantastic and the service was superb. I'm pretty sure that the sushi chefs have "I Dream of Genie" powers because as soon as we ordered, our rolls were on the table made exactly as we ordered them. The prices are in line with what we're used to paying and the menu has a good variety of choices. We'll definitely be back. . .and it's absolutely worth drive to Henderson from the Strip.
OMG!!!!  If you want some incredible sushi, fly to Las Vegas. Was just absolutely incredible. Would I fly back to Vegas from Seattle just to eat here. Oh, hell yeah!!

I loved this place. The atmosphere is amazing, I love how the staff wear authentic Japanese kimonos. The food was delicious and the prices are very reasonable. We will definitely be making this our go-to sushi spot in Henderson. Great service too. Thanks!

We live in LA and go here with a group of 40 friends every year as a special outing. The staff is so accommodating and fun it's amazing, given how chaotic serving 40 people at once could be.  The sushi is always great and the names of the rolls are a lot of fun.  Everything I've tried has been top notch, and with 40 people along I figure I've tried about everything.
Had the burning your stomach roll and it was enjoyable.  Difficult to tell the quality of the sushi since there was so much sauce and mixed with other items but definitely tasty.

Very ordinary restaurant. The food is very so so. If you want to enjoy your food then don't go there.  The staff was present only at order and to pay. In between you will not see anyone.   At payment, I recommend to not pay cash as you will not get your change back.   Its a well deserved 1 star. Don't bother to stop there.

This is the sushi place that I tell everyone about. It is "Americanized" sushi in an "authentic" environment." (if that makes any sense) There are lots of unique rolls of which I highly recommend the "cherry blossom" and the "screaming orgasm!" It is Korean owned but you will be greeted in Japanese. lol The TVs in contrast are always set to American sports. The waitresses are  adorable, dressed in kimonos, and are very helpful once you figure out how to communicate what you want. Good service, amazing food and reasonable prices consistently make "I love sushi" worth the 15 minute drive off the Las Vegas Strip.
Nasty sushi that tastes like the garbage you can buy pre-made at the supermarket. The simulated crab was the biggest turn off.
It was ok , but I had better sushi  i just wish they had a revolving sushi place here in Las vegas very hard to find one out here .

This place has some ridiculous names for their sushi, but it's entertaining to talk about.  The waitresses are good looking.  The sushi's very good.  This place has really good miso soup, and the sushi tastes fresh.  They also have some very unique dishes.  I'm a big fan of this place.

My first time here and it was amazing!! The fish was fresh and the presentation was outstanding!  Our servers were very attentive and informative for our decisions.  Very unique sushi combos and the flavors are crave worthy!  A return visit for sure!

Had a really great dinner here the other day with a group of friends! Food was really good and pretty quick to come! My only complaint was that service aside from food delivery was slow at times, felt like the wait staff hid behind the counter a lot and never really checked in with us to see how we were doing.   Overall still a great dine out!
I love I Love Sushi. My favorite sushi place. Kitchen Sink, Tuna Tartar, Screaming Orgasm, Spicy Salmon Roll, and age dashi tofu are my favorites. Get fresh wasabi.

I love sushi is hands down the best sushi spot in Vegas!!! The place is always packed so be prepared for that!!! The service is fast though so you never have to wait long!!! The food is fresh. They have a variety of options. A few of my favorites...Cherry Blossom, Joes Special and the Screaming Orgasm. Consistency is the key here!!! Food is always AMAZING!!!

Fun atmosphere and lively. The design is a campy but flashy asian decor. Some may say its tacky, but I love the camp factor. The service is very attentive, but a bit rushed and comes off a little pushy. The food.... veggy tempura was mediocre, shrimp tempura as poor, the chicken teriyaki was ok, the beef teriyaki was bad, and the halibut tempura was poor. The sushi rolls just very average. We did not order any specialty rolls. The sashimi was good. Maybe we should have tried the specialty rolls... I was unimpressed.
Best sushi in the state! We have ordered so many different dishes and they are all outstanding. I would eat here every day if possible. 10 stars.

Fresh sushi in Nevada? Yeah, its not just theory anymore. I visited "I Love Sushi" because of its stellar ratings (and I was lost). I used to seeing 4 star reviews for places, but the reviews on Yelp were a whole other matter. When everyone is raving about specific sushi chefs, -BY NAME - you have to know something is great.  I am so glad I tried this place. The little extra's are great. Hand towels, exceptional service. Even when you sit down, people all around you are talking to the chef by name. Crazy! I love it.   Each roll was exceptional. I actually ordered 2 more than I could eat because I loved it so much. I am a pretty picky person when it comes to sushi, but each roll was better than the last.   Hands down one of the best sushi places in Vegas. Check it out.

This Sushi restaurant is by far the BEST.  Their rolls are delish!  It's a clean restaurant with great ambiance!  I highly recommend this place.  I've been to many, many sushi restaurants.  This has been my favorite so far.  It doesn't matter if it's Korean owned.  In fact, I think the Korean owned sushi restaurants are better.  90% of sushi restaurants are Korean owned anyway.  Enjoy!

So I guess I recently went on a sushi splurge. What can I say? I love sushi! Hah  This place was hustling and bustling the Friday night that I came. We had a group of 8 people and they accommodated all of us very nicely in one booth. It was my first time here so I didn't know what to expect. It's a sushi/Japanese restaurant run by Koreans with waitresses in kimonos. Interesting..   Let's start off by the saying that the specialty sushi roll menu is.. well.. extensive. Like really extensive. There are so many options.. maybe too many options for my indecisiveness haha.. The sushi was not bad though. I ordered the Ryan roll which was basically a crunchy shrimp tempura roll with maguro and special sauce. It was quite tasty.  Our service was great! Considering how busy the place was, our server was really attentive and fun.   So why just the 4 stars? I was a little thrown back by the price of the rolls. My roll was $15 already. I was a little disappointed to find out they didn't have a AYCE option but it is what it is. (I think people from Hawaii are just too spoiled with cheap food) They also have bento boxes/dinner specials that also looked yummy. I would give those a try if I come back next time!

Made my order online and when arrived to pick up my order it wasn't ready. Boss man said he didn't look at his phone. Food is pretty bad quality. Ordered some sashimi tuna(stinks like old fish), Angus beef stake( wasn't tender) I'm sure they gave me a cheap cut of beef, and a pork cuttlet ( very dry and over cooked). I would have gave half star if I had the choice.

I finally was in Henderson. I have been trying to get to this place for a while and finally the day came and I have to say it was not disappointed.   Located in back of a strip mall off of eastern  ave. As soon as we walked in we were greeted. The waitresses are in kimonos which is kind of cool as for the decor it feels like you in Japan. Their booths are closed which is nice and intimate if you have a date. Service was great as well kept the refills coming and always asked if everything was ok.   As for the food the fish quality was really good fish melted in my mouth had the screaming orgasm, chef special roll both equally as good. I just wish they were closer to Summerlin.   Def will be back sooner than later!

Omg this place has the best spicy sushi I have ever had. The "burning your stomach"  is a delicious blend of fresh fish with mouth burning sauces that aren't overpowering or take the flavor away from the fish. It's amazing and I can't even explain how quickly and efficiently they churn out their rolls. Very fast and very competent service. I have been to many sushi places and they are very fast paced and getting your roll order wrong has been fairly common for me. Not the case at all here.   You want good food and amazing, ORIGINAL SPICY rolls, this is the place for it.

Name is cheesy but food is good.  I'm a fan of all-you-can-eat, but my sister and friends convinced me to give this place a try.  We were greeted by a kimono-clad hostess/server, which was a nice touch and sat in a wooden, semi-enclosed booth.  There is an extensive list of sushi rolls with extraordinary names!  Very non-traditional, but still yummy.  I ordered the bento box with teriyaki salmon and some kind of mackerel.  It came with a little bowl of rice and a tempura rice ball, which was unique and of course miso soup and salad.  Also ordered a pepper tuna plate, which I shared with my hubby.  It was slices of pepper tuna in a yummy ponzu-like sauce.  Delicious.  Fish was fresh and service was good.  This place is way on the other side of the world, but I would definitely go again if my sister was so inclined! :)
If you don't want the usual "All you can eat" sushi then this is the place for you. The rolls are very flavorful and taste delicious.

This is our favorite sushi restaurant on this side of town. The menu is extensive but it's all good. Anything on the menu with yellowtail is my favorite. I've been for lunch only a couple of times and their specials are well-priced. Dinner can get pricey. Make sure to make reservations for dinner because it can get quite busy at night.

Had dinner here based off the reviews, gave it three stars for uniqueness and atmosphere. Overall sushi was ok, bit heavy and over sauced. Some ingredients didn't seem fresh or were overcooked. Lots of rolls to choose from, I'd probably got to SushiMon their rolls are a bit more well made, and service is better. We had to wait for drink refills a lot and they brought out all the rolls at once so the hot entrees chilled before we could eat them.

So I ignored all the bad delivery reviews, because this place is near my office and though I'd go eat in. I don't often say stay away - but stay away from this place. The seaweed salad was tough, and parts of it were frozen. Yuck. The tuna sushi had actually gone bad - had this mushy, glue-like texture and a funky taste. Had to spit it out. When I told the waitress she giggled and said she'd never tried it. I tried to explain that it was actually bad, as in rotten, and she just walked away. Gross.

Amazing and fast service!  Great atmosphere.  Definitely will be going back soon.  Prices we great, plus they were very accommodating with our young children.  They brought out their food first and fast.  Super nice staff.
Delicious! My husband and I were recommended to I Love Sushi and went for our anniversary. The fish was fresh and all of the rolls were perfect! We will definitely be returning!!

This is our go to sushi restaurant.  Great sushi, fun rolls with fun names, and excellent service.  James, the owner, is hands on and runs the place very efficiently.  He makes sure tables are cleared quickly and service is smooth.  It gets busy often, but they turn tables quickly.  It also has a fun energy to it!

I Love Sushi is OK.  Not bad, but really just ok.  I've had so many people tell me its so good and...eh.  I was totally underwhelmed when I went.  It's definitely a cute place, and their menu is huge.  But the menu items aren't that different from each other.  I found myself flipping the menu over a bunch to see what the difference between a couple rolls were.  I think it would be good if you are going with a large group and you're more concerned with having fun than eating awesome sushi.

I will definitely venture out here again when we visit Las Vegas! Everything was delicious and the place was packed but we didn't have to wait long. The sashimi salad has an amazing dressing. Their rolls maybe a little too much sauce on it but other than that a super yum sushi experience!!

I love this place!  I took a friend there for his birthday  and they were awesome  and the food is always good, professional staff, timely service, always checking back if anything is needed!  It was so cool they brought my friend out cake and ice cream with a candle and we sang happy birthday!  He loved it!  A must go, it's a superb place to eat!

my taste buds had an amazing experience! i got 4 different items and they were all as good as i was expecting after ready the reviews! it was a busy night but the owner took 5 min to  get us situated. if you like flavor thats for sure the good spot!
Great change of pace from the countless AYCE places in town. You can definitely taste the difference in both quality and freshness of the fish.
Fabulous sushi, wonderful. The food was excellent, and the atmosphere was very authentic. I highly recommend this place.

I truly love this place. We are spoiled. When we go get sushi anywhere else, it never compares to I Love Sushi. They are the best. Great staff and great food. Bam Bam Special is amazing. Also, try a Sexy Time... very nice.

Maybe we were there on an off night, because our experience was terrible. My husband and I arrived on a Wednesday night for dinner. We had a table for 2, and the restaurant was not overly busy. Our server was polite, and continually checked on us, which is great. We placed our order, my husband ordered from the hibachi, and I ordered 2-rolls, and we ordered saki. Nothing too crazy or out of the ordinary.  My husband received his meal within about 5-10 minutes after placing the order, but it came out without the rice. No big deal, we can live with that. The meal was hot, and looked fine. The taste was fine, but the meat was very tough. Again, we can kinda live with that, hey tough met happens. We waited and waited for my order to come through...and waited...and waited....  We were watching the sushi bar the entire time, and there were sushi chefs available to make our remaining order, so we thought, maybe our order got lost. Our waitress returned when my husband was almost done with his meal and brought the rice she forgot to bring out during the first arrival of his food. Rice was very bad.  My order finally came 45-minutes later. Let that sink in. 45-minutes later. 2-rolls. They were absolutely horrible. I love sushi. I love sashimi. The rolls tasted like really bad rotten fish, and even had the rotten smell. I gagged with the first bite, and thought maybe it's in my head. I tried bite number two and lost it. The waitress returned and she asked "Do you not like your meal?" I responded by saying what I thought, and she said "Thank you for being so nice to me, most people want the manager, thank you." At this point I just wanted taco bell. She didn't offer a refund or to even give a discount. We didn't ask. We had already spent almost 2-hours there and walked out paying $60 for a horrible experience.  By the way, this was our 3rd time there, and it was only my first experience that was great. The sushi chef was Joe, and we sat at the bar. He was not there the other two times, so maybe he's the key to the success? I don't know, but we will not return. :(

The place can be really busy so recommend visiting on off nights or off dinner hours.  The sushi is always fresh and the have some interesting dishes.  We have been here several times and it has become our fav sushi spot in the valley for quality at off-strip prices.
Good atmosphere  Great place to introduce sushi to a hesitant consumer

I have to say that " I Love Sushi " is definitely one of the best that I have tried in this town to date.  Food was Very good, service was also Very good.  I will go back and I am going back next week!

Tried this sushi for the first time. It is not an all you can eat. We order the salad screaming orgasm and few rolls ( menu of rolls is huge ) and it was fresh and delicious. The ambiance of this restaurant is nice and spacious. Service was a little bit slow but it was at the same time of the CES convention and the restaurant was packed. I will be back for sure next time i am in Henderson

This place is amazing! I usually avoid coming here with friends because they do not offer AYCE. However, their grade of fish is a little better than most sushi places, their portions are a little bigger, and in my opinion you get fuller faster! I find myself having to eat so many rolls to get full at other places! Here, I get stuffed from one Japanese Lasagna roll and maybe an order of calamari (so 'all you can eat' is not necessary).   When I'm craving Japanese Lasagna I HAVE to get it from here! They have the best. Today, I decided to order a Cherry Blossom (no rice) and a Japanese Lasagna! The Cherry Blossom was incredible and HUGE!! I was full after eating half of it.  I don't think you can go wrong with anything from the menu :)

I went here yesterday. I was seated quickly wait staff was excellent. But the sushi was over priced and not very good. I had the monkey roll and the salmon lover no rice they were 12.00 each not impressed I won't be going back

This might be a biased review because I have only been here once during the hot lunch hour.  My friend and I were seated for about 15 minutes with our menus down and ready to order w/ out a peep from any of the waitresses.  I was already displeased with this considering, I had to go back to work within a certain timeframe.  I hate when lunch hours take longer than they should!  And the restaurant was not even full!  Boo!  Second, our orders took awhile to come out and we ONLY ordered 2 rolls, a salad, and an appetizer. Really?  That should not have taken very long to come out!  I was fairly disappointed.    Good thing the waitress was always apologetic.  We ordered the Garlic Chili Pepper Edamame, best edamame appetizer I've ever had.  Loved it!  We also ordered the rainbow roll; it was fresh and good tasting.  The crispy spicy tuna rice cake was amazing.  Has a nice jalapeno kick to it and definitely something I would come back for.  Their sashimi salad was ok; fish wasn't as fresh as I would have liked it, and I'm not too fond of their salty special sauce.  I might be back to try more rolls before I give up on this place.  There are just so many good sushi joints in the Southwest area to come back here.  We'll see!  Stay tuned!  Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (45/365).

Love this place! It has a wide variety of options which will surely satisfy any kind of sushi you're craving. They were easily able to bring us separate checks for our rolls as well, which has been an issue at so many other restaurants.  Our server noticed some gifts on the table for a birthday we were celebrating and she brought out some ice cream for us all free of charge without us even asking which I was really impressed by. She really went above and beyond. We also stuck around for a couple of hours after we finished our meal because I hadn't seen my friends in a while and we were catching up. Granted it wasn't really a busy night, our server didn't try to shoo us away or make us feel bad for lingering. Overall, great food and great customer service!

My girlfriend loves the sushi here and they have a large selection of other things for people with me that can't stand fish and sushi.  Place gets very busy and crowded at times so you may want to come early or at non peak times.

I must say I have been to many sushi restaurants in many different states.  My son and I are very picky about sushi.  We found "I LOVE SUSHI" a few months ago and I am not exaggerating when I say I am there 3 to 4 times a week. The owner Milton is the most friendly and inviting man and the staff, especially Alice are all so sweet, kind and friendly. And the food.  OH WOW. The food is amazing. Never disappointed. I am in Awe of this place. I cannot get enough. I bring all my friends. Sometimes I am embarrassed about how many times a week I am there however I am just going to be me and do it!  Thank you I LOVE SUSHI and yes, I will see you tomorrow!

I divide sushi into 2 different kinds: First, there are the restaurants devoted to serving fresh raw fish, prepared very simply, highlighting the flavors of the fish. Then, there are the restaurants that serve AYCE, or various fried rolls, or rolls with lots of different sauces, or rolls with weird sexual names.  I love sushi falls into this second category. It's not that it's bad - actually, I thought it was quite good - but don't go there expecting a great meal of nigiri and sashimi. Instead, order your 'screaming orgasm' and your 'sushi nachos' and enjoy them....and order some extra yum yum sauce on the side.

I eat here ALOT and can't believe I am just now reviewing this place.  This is truly a great sushi spot.  Although it is not AYCE, I think for the quality of fish, it is perfectly priced.  I never leave here feeling like I overpaid.   Every roll is cut into huge pieces.  If you have a small mouth (like myself), it makes for some interesting eating trying to cram a whole piece into your mouth.  But it's also very filling!  I'ved tried the majority of the rolls at this place.  Here are a list of my favorites:  Kiss of Fire - Very spicy.  This is one of my favorite rolls I've had anywhere Franky Special - Just the right amount of spicy and sweet Burning my stomach - This thing is hot!! love it! Tastes Like My X-Girlfriend - Got to love the names of some of these rolls, but this is very good.  I can't say enough good things about this place.  I've been here on a Tuesday, Friday, Saturday and I've never had a problem getting a table, but it is always crowded.  The service, this means everyone from the door person to the chefs, is excellent!  I love the atmosphere here, too.  It's very lively and has kind of a bar feel which really adds to the experience.    I don't care if my Japanese food is prepared and served by Koreans.  Good food is good food!  One word of caution:  this place does go kind of heavy on the sauce, so if that is not your thing, you may not love this place as much as I do.

I am very picky about my sushi. This is the first sushi place where I do not have to order a backup plate ( chicken dish or yakisoba or something). I love the kiss of fire or the Gary's special. Drink several bottles of nigori every time. Crunch roll and California roll are very good. Also the himachi is out of control. So soft and buttery. Will be back many more times. Best sushi I've had!!

Ambiance was great, service was stellar and the food was divine! I brought my 4 year old along without any trouble, but it would be great for a bubbly happening date spot too. I can't wait to head back and try the scallop shooters. We tried the chili garlic edamame to start and I'm so glad we did! I'm so glad I finally got to try this sushi spot. I'll definitely be back!

I had lunch here with family (not my kids) and the food and service were great. Don't let your kids read the name of the rolls as they are R-rated but very entertaining.  I would definitely come back!!
Probably some of the best sushi I've ever had. Love the atmosphere there too. The traditional dresses add to the vibe.

Nice lunch today. Great service, Imagine a cool Japanese Bar, calm music. I ordered the Flower Roll, Japanese lasagna, Sashimi salad and of course the famous Screaming Orgasm  Excellent! The minus one star was for a better mochi and the decor is kinda cheesy for the pricey meal. However fun great place to enjoy good sushi!

My absolute favorite sushi spot in Vegas. So lucky that i live 5 minutes away from this restaurant. I frequent this spot so much that they know that i like to sit at the bar and they already know my order when i sit down. How's that for service. Lucky for them i am a creature of habit. I order the spicy edamame right off the bat. Soooo good, and spicy! A Screaming orgasm is a MUST! i can handle a small on my own or I'll order a large to split with my date. Joe is my favorite sushi guy when i get there at night. If i go too early I'll miss him, but the other guys are pretty attentive and friendly. I always see someone i know there so i know this place has to be pretty popular. Every once and a while i will make a friend there. To all you newbies, i guarantee this will be your new hot spot! But prepare to wait for a table if you show up during prime time which is usually around 7. This place is poppin ny then. Totally worth the wait though.

The sushi here is really delicious. The fish is fresh and of good quality. They have a large selection of sushi rolls to choose from, most of them are creative and have a nice twist. They also have funny/ interesting names  I had the Crazy horse, and the monkey roll. So delicious. I love Philadelphia rolls so I picked these two because they had salmon and cream cheese. The monkey roll had so much flavor, beautifully presented. Basically a Philadelphia roll but with a twist as it has mango and "red crunch" on top with a sauce, I don't remember what it was though. The crazy horse was more simple but equally satisfying. It was tempura but it was a nice thin line not super thick like other places, and with that you get the full flavor of the inside (the salmon, cream cheese, ect)    My bf had the last call which had mozzarella and crab. It was surprisingly good considering cheese isn't traditional included in sushi, but it was different and delicious   The lobster roll was too plain for my taste but it was well made  Overall this place is awesome. The sushi is creative and of great quality, the sushi chefs are very friendly and are more than happy to recommend what sushi to get and are knowledgeable about what they're doing.  The decor is ok, nothing exceptional. The service is also whatevers, the waitress accidentally poked me in the face with my chopsticks while taking my plates away and only said a whispered sorry, but didn't really care.   Wish I had taken pics of the food but it was that good that I gobbled it up and forgot.

I never drove around Henderson before, but after looking for I Love Sushi, I realized it's a really nice residential area with TONS of eateries around! Definitely convenient if you're staying at South Point and don't feel like going on the strip or downtown.  I Love Sushi has a very Japanese-style interior which I liked since it makes it more authentic. They have literally HUNDREDS of different types of specialty rolls..not to mention unique (and sometimes embarrassing) names for them! No kidding, it was a little overwhelming to be quite honest, haha. We ended up ordering the Screaming Orgasm, I Love My Ass roll, and the Spider roll. I enjoyed all of them, but I think my favorite would have to be the I Love My Ass roll. Super savory and delicious! The Screaming Orgasm was definitely good, too - it's more like a salad though, just FYI. The rolls are a little pricey, but their portions are pretty generous IMO, so no complaints here! I left with a VERY happy belly :)  So yes, recommended and I would definitely not mind eating here again if I'm ever staying at South Point again.

It was packed when we walked in but they make sure you are seated in a timely manner. The sushi is good and fresh and the waiters are very nice. It's not ayce but after my wife and I ordered what we did and were full the price came out to almost the same it would if we did an ayce sushi place. Long story short good service and good sushi a must try.
The food and service was amazing! Every dish had a wonderful aroma and exquisite taste. My favorite suchi restaurant!!

Wish I could give 3.5, but will be generous.    We ordered entrees rather than sushi.  We first shared the butter yaki appetizer with scallops.  I don't associate scallops with Japanese food so I don't really know why we ordered this, but OMG they were the most tender scallops I have ever eaten!  And the portion size was very generous, so we took half home.  They were still surprisingly tender after being reheated in a microwave four days later.  Wow!    The rest of our food was ok to very good, not spectacular.  We both ordered entrees that came with 2 main items.  My vegetable tempura was very good and the salmon teriyaki good, but my husband didn't like his two selections very well (mackerel and spicy chicken, both only ok).  However, the miso soup, salad and side dishes that come with the entrees were all good and we had a lot of food left over.  Overall, we were satisfied.  It was busy and we had to wait about 15 minutes to get seated.   It seemed noisy in the main/bar area, but luckily we ended up just to the left of the front door where it was a little quieter.  If we go back, which we probably will, we'll try the sushi because I suspect that's what they do best.  (Maybe the butter yaki again, too.)  But if we're in the mood for non-sushi entrees, we will probably stick with En Sushi.

This is my go-to restaurant if I'm craving Japanese cuisine. Very fresh, fast and friendly service. I usually order sashimi and non-riced items.   Some of my favorite dishes ~   Hamachi Kama  Sashimi Salad Spicy Chicken Pepper Tuna  Dined here a number of times ~ the service, quality of food and cleanliness has been consistent.

I know it's slightly odd to have a sweet flavor of sushi in your mouth, but you have to try the Monkey Roll! (it has cream cheese and mangoes). Pretty much everything on their menu is fresh and delicious. I've had great service there every single time i've gone and the servers are always ready to assist you.

When it comes to presentation this place executes that one thing completely. The food tastes as good as it looks, but if you're on a budget this place my be out of reach depending on what's in your pocket. Even their establishment looks amazing. I love this place and love their "screaming orgasm roll"!

My son and I went and liked it. We normally go to Sushimon but since we were in the east side of town, thought to try it. It wasn't all you can eat, but the amount of food we ate came out to what it would have cost at all you can eat. We ordered 3 full rolls each $10-14, and we also ordered a lunch special for $9 with tempura and chicken teriyaki, that include soup, and gyoza. We had a custom salmon roll that my son likes  and Gary's special roll and something else that my son ordered. Gary's roll was really great. I liked the sauce - sesame vinegar that was slightly spicy. The fish was really fresh. You can tell the difference. It wasn't fishy at all and was velvety. The lunch cost $51 without tip. It's a little more expensive than Sushimon but it was good. I'd go back.
One of my favorite sushi place! Great service and absolutely the best sushi place in Henderson!

I would give zero if possible.   I read through all the reviews and the negative ones describe my experience to the T.   Terrible food, terrible service, sticky tables, weirdly limited menu unless you get all you can eat.   Avoid this place at all costs. I can't believe it's been in business so long.  If you are looking at this review and wondering if I'm just picky - look at my stats. This is the first place I've ever awarded ONE star to. Don't forget, I would have given it ZERO if possible.

My husband loves sushi, so it was his pick for date night and I Love Sushi was we're we went.  Located behind a Wendy's and a Black Bear Diner, we parked and went in and immediately noticed how packed it was. We we seated in one of the last free tables and edamame with soy sauce brought right over.  My husband ordered for us, putting in a few different choices. I am less adventurous than he when it comes to food, I keep my sushi pretty simple. California roll or tuna roll. My husband goes for the eel and octopus, with more intrepid ingredients.  All in all the sushi was good, and service too. Next time it's his pick for sushi I would be fine returning there.  The bill minus tip was $75.

I have been all over this lovely town of Las Vegas in search of a sushi place I can call home, and after nearly 5 years off and on, I have finally found it. I Love Sushi was AMAZING!!! From the two sided menu with endless amounts of creative goodness, to the hilarious names of the items (ex. Screaming Orgasm, The Threesome, etc.), to the timely and polite service from both the waitresses and sushi chef's, this place is great.  Enough seating that even when its busy, it shouldnt be too long of a way and the food comes out nearly as fast and fresh as when you order it.  Pricing is GREAT!  GO TO I LOVE SUSHI ASAP!!!

I drive 25 miles across town at least three times a week passing 100+ other sushi restaurants.  I love for the Screaming O, Something Wrong 69, Jackpot Special, and Grand Canyon rolls.  The wait is never long, and if it were, it would be worth it.
A must! Try Kitchen sink and Gary's special rolls. People are very nice and super professional.

Not bad sushi.  My husband and I went there about 7:30 on a Friday and got in within 5 minutes, even though the restaurant was quite busy.  We got the Vegas (I know a strange thing for locals to get!) boat for 2 and a caterpillar roll.  I thought it was a bit pricey ($47 for 2); however, the portions were generous.  The two layers of beef in the beef teriyaki made it worth.  Not bad.  More than generous for two!

Came to Vegas for the week, had to try this place based on the yelp reviews and interesting looking menu.  Variety was overwhelming, tried just a couple items and was full In no time.  Would have loved to try more .  My suggestion would be half roll option or sampler plates.  If your looking for variety they have it. Atmosphere  at lunch was quiet and comfortable.
Stumbled upon this one day - thought I would give it a try.  Typical sushi place - sushi was pretty good. Price is decent.  Party trays are decent. =)

It's good. Proportions and quality of food were regular. I enjoyed the decor and how the servers were dressed to represent the Japanese culture. Had the unagi bowl which came with a salad and the jackpot roll. After all the sushi I ate that day, every roll started to taste the same (I had ayce sushi at the Kaya restaurant earlier) so I can't rave about any of their rolls in particular because none of them stood out and that's not a bad thing...I just couldn't find anything that stood out exceptionally to give this place 5 stars. Anyways, try their garlic edamame.

If you asked me 2 years ago where the best sushi in town was I would say I love sushi easily. Unfortunately after going there at least 10 times in the past 2 years I have to say that the service has gotten progressively worse every single time.  Every time I feel like I have to say well, the sushi is still the best. Yes, the sushi is really good. 5 stars for the sushi. 1 star for the service.  They need a bigger restaurant, double the staff.
