It's too busy to do good business. I'm sure they make good money because there's no doubt about the sushi quality, but man I can do it anymore. I always try to go early so I could get a seat, you have to smash through people coming in the door. Then once seated it may take a really long time to place order. Then once order is placed you have to wait a really long time to get the food. You may want to order your second round of drinks ahead of time if you are drinking because it's going to be a long time before you see your server again. I can't really do this place anymore.

Excellent restaurant. Very consistent in quality of service and food. Service, in our opinion, is the best of all sushi places (off the Strip). Surprisingly, our favorite roll is Mistake roll (one of their cheapest), we love their oyster shooters too! The sashimi salad is terrible though (but it's more like an exception).

I been to I love Sushi twice already in one month. A great place with a very busy but cosy environment. Sushi rolls are big portions and taste delicious!! The energy and the atmosphere is great at this place! Can't wait to go back again!!!

Best Sushi Place in Las Vegas! My favorite rolls are the I love Sushi Roll, Tiger Roll and the Kitchen Sink with tuna! Always a great time! Best place in the house is dining at the Sushi Bar. My Fiance does not eat sushi, but always orders the spicy chicken with shrimp added! So Good!!!!!!!!

My favorite sushi restaurant I have ever been too. The food is absolutely amazing and the staff treats you so well. We regularly come at least every other week if not every week and we always order the same things Nigiri sake . Spicy edamame . Pan fried gyoza. Nigiri . And then we always choose a roll. You can't go wrong!

Worth every 5* review. Friendly staff, Sake-bombs, great value.  Although they aren't on OpenTable we always work around that.  At every sushi place the most important things to me (in order) - Fresh fish - Excellent service - Cold mugs - Good happy hour / late night - Unique flavor combinations - On OpenTable so I don't have to wait for a table and so I can get my points - Chefs and staff who will pound 3-9 sake bombs with you.  I highly highly recommend I Love Sushi

The sushi is Yum, but if you have to eat gluten free I wouldn't recommend it. They aren't too knowledgeable about Gluten Free and I always leave with a tummy in pain no matter how plain I get my food. They do have a gluten free soy sauce which helps, but the staff isn't too knowledgeable on it so be very careful. They are pretty pricey as well.
The food was amazing and the Sushi Chef's were great to interact with. Worth the trip off the strip for the food.

I love this place!  Great and fresh sushi  just darn good.   I ordered dynamite and a selection of other sushi rolls ... all were delicious   Even the restroom was cute ... so were the waitress staff ... up to par with Los Angeles for sure and cheaper !

One of, if not the, best sushi joint in Las Vegas. Night out with the wife? Check. Lunch with the boss? Check. Catching up with friends? Check.   Amazing rolls, always fresh. Service is always easy. In the Green Valley area it's a place you need to visit. Personal favorites include the Cherry Blossom and the Candy Cane. Cannot go wrong.

The different spicy sushi rolls they have will get you going!!! Lots of spice. Great presentation and service as well :) One of the better off the strip environments you will find in town. A happening place. One negative is one of my rolls. It was a white albacore one. FISHY!!! First sushi roll that I've ever had that was this way... Still I've been here enough to go back.

I Love Sushi does not do AYCE.. Which would not be a problem for me if the sushi quality was better/the prices weren't so high. I ordered 1 roll and a small beer and ended up paying $19. My money would have been better spent at an AYCE elsewhere.  We made a reservation for a table of 8. Easy, no problem, on time. 7PM Thursday night and the place was PACKED- Play it safe and make a reservation! The waitresses are all dressed in cheap kimonos and are HORRIBLE. One of the waitresses came over and asked who ordered the 'Screamo' (the roll was called the 'Screaming Orgasm') The restaurant was loud, we were a party of 8- none of us claimed the roll. The waitress ended up getting extremely angry insisting that it was our roll. We eventually figured out which roll she was talking about apologized for not understanding, but come on. Why work at a restaurant with a ton of dirty names if you don't want to say them out loud? It wasn't our fault we thought you had a different roll!  The sushi boat with terriyaki, katsu, sushi we ordered was larger than expected and worth the price if you're going to be sharing with a large group.  Candy Cane: Yellowtail and tuna covered rolls that looks like a candy cane. Not too saucy, perfect amount of raw.  Kiss of fire: A popular roll but I'm unsure why. It's spicier than anything I've previously experienced and tastes only of sricha.  Overall the sushi=4, service=1.
The name is deceiving because you would think only sushi.  But they have udon, sukiyaki, tonkatsu, tempura.... and it's delicious!  The service is excellent!  Would definitely go back!

After not having sushi for 3 months, I was craving some Japanese cooking. My friend and I walked into this place, very excited to sit down and feast. She ordered: Dynamite & Spicy Salmon Rolls, and being a veggie, I got myself the Spicy Vegetarian and Yam Tempura Rolls. Mind you we only paid $5.99 per person. Our food came out within 10 minutes. For being tiny girls, we both eat like Sumo Wrestlers...so we were afraid it wouldn't be enough. But, these rolls were well-made, and quite filling. For the price, service, and complimentary Miso Soup and Salad with an interesting dressing, we walked out quite satisfied. And, the set up/decor was cute for a lil hole in the wall. I wouldn't mind going back.  Check out their website for more pictures: http://www.ilovesushi.ca/gallery/index.html
Yum! Yum! Yum! Get the dynamite roll. So good. I go here as often as I can. Try it!
The food is fantastic and the staff is very friendly and accommodating! We dine almost once a week and have had good experiences!

I love sushi because this place is good,  name says it all!   Every Roll has a unique explosion of flavors that complement the fish each roll showcases.  Presentation is appetizing and the size is generous. The fish is fresh and rice is flavorful!    One of my favorite features in their rolls is the little crunchiness from the soft shell crab and/or shrimp tempura inside the roll.  My favorite rolls: Gary Special and Stuffed Tomato.  Lately I've been enjoying the Nabeyaki Udon soup served in a cast iron pot which is so nice during the cold days!   Been a regular customer for almost a decade!

I am so glad I was introduced to I love sushi! Their restaurant ambiance/decor and servers are very authentic . I recommend I love sushi for people looking for a high quality meal willing to shell out the extra bucks. This place will not satisfy you if you are looking for $20 all you can eat establishment- this is not it. Their a la carte sushi rolls have a huge variety to choose from. I only noticed on my second visit some of their sushi rolls have naughty names which made me giggle. My two favorite rolls are the candy cane roll with soft shell crab and the I love sushi special roll wth regular and spicy tuna in a garlic ponzu sauce. Even though this place can be packed I always get seated and served quickly and efficiently. So far my favorite sushi place in Vegas.

Korean owned sushi bar.  They always treat me well and recognized me on my second visit.  I had something that tasted a little fishy (it wasn't a popular item) and let the manager know.  He apologized and removed the charge from the bill.  Great service!

I went for the first time on Sunday 12 June 2016 and had a really good time. Carlos was my waiter and he was really great. He took care of me while I waited at the sushi bar for my friend to arrive. The food was awesome and the manager was really friendly. One of my favorite things about this place are the names for the sushi rolls and the selection! I will be returning!

Best Sushi place in Vegas! My wife and discovered this place about two months ago.  A week hasn't gone by without us going there.  Always crowded, but never had to wait more than 15 minutes to sit.  Staff is friendly and very good.  My wife's favorite cut roll is the Double D.  She can't get enough of the Chef's Special sauce.   I love the hand rolls.  They really pile the sushi in there.  They don't hold back and I love it.  The selection is unbelievable and the quality matches it.  Love the place and super happy we found our go to sushi place.

What can I say?! Best sushi, best service, awesome atmosphere! This place is alive. When it comes to sushi, I would only recommend this place. We've created so many memories in here.  I love this place!
The best miso soup! Highly recommend! This little sushi gem served some of the best sushi I've had in a long time.

Sushis are fresh. Place is big enough to accomodate a lot of people. Bento boxes are not ideal, specially the terriyakis. Sauce is too sweet, and meat are small portion. The eel sauce is not perfect and not thick enough. But overall, if you're a sushi lover. This place would be decent enough.

This place will take care of you whether you know what you want or whether you want to describe and have them make it. Very fresh and tasty. They greet you in the proper way as well. The food was awesome and the prices are completely reasonable.     Sitting at the sushi bar is the way to go.

5 stars isnt enough for this place...... literally the BEST sushi i have EVER had..... they have so many different types of rolls and well a great selection of hand rolls.  i eat here about twice a week (which is not enough, if u ask me!!!).  the fish is so fresh, the flavors are amazing, and the atmosphere is fun too!  The staff are all friendly.  As soon as you walk in, the entire staff greets you.    Some of my favorite rolls include the screaming orgasm, spring mountain roll, almost 90%, and the lisa hand roll.  Just writing this review makes me want to go have some now!!!!!
Still my favorite sushi in Las Vegas. There are dozens of sushi places within ten minutes of where I live, and this will always be my first choice. Recommend!

So I have had a back and forth journey with this restaurant, and this has what has kept me from reviewing it.  I finally feel ready.  The first thing to know about this place is that there is no all you can eat and the rolls often are averaging around 13 dollars each (the ones I ordered normally around 14).  This automatically puts an expectation that they should be higher quality than an average sushi joint.  When you come inside the waitresses are dressed in traditional Japanese clothing and the restaurant is very sizeable, with lots of tables and booths, and a huge sushi bar.  Often there are many sushi chefs working behind it.  Despite its massive size, even on a busy night the service was relatively quick, and they work like a well oiled machine.  Now to the food, the first time I ever came here was about 4 years ago after being told I had to by multiple people.  I ordered a roll that involved mango and some other fun flavors, yet it was so bland and flavorless.  I refused to go back after that, and believed this place was over hyped.  I had a go to spot kaizen down the road so I had no need for them, however kaizen began to go down hill to the point that I gave up in them and jumped ship as a loyal customer.    I was desperate and in need of sushi that was close by so I thought ok I will give I love sushi one more shot.  I ended up really enjoying my rolls! Totally different experience, I thought maybe I had just ordered wrong last time. I had got the 90 percent roll, bam bam roll and spring mountain roll I believe.  These were packed with flavor, and I continued to have a similar experience the times I would drive up to get my sushi fix, until about 6 months ago.  I went alone just wanting grab one roll, and it was one I had enjoyed in the past.  It had ponzu sauce on it and shrimp tempura and many other yummy things.  However they weren't yummy, it tasted so much saltier than normal and the tempura was not crispy, it tasted liken it had been sitting out and the pack on the roll was sloppy. I was sad, and my craving not fullfilled with goodness.    I hoped it was a fluke so I went this past Saturday since monta was closed for renovations, and I was starving for something Japanese. I was greeted by insanity! It was a football night, and I guess this place becomes a sports bar when that happens, it was so loud I couldn't hear my boyfriend talk.  Whatever just give me good food that is all I want, we ordered the niku udon for the first time.  They have the medium thickness udon, not as thin as I prefer, but not thick like slugs.  It was some of the better niku in the valley,with a really full bodied broth, and the reason this review is not two stars.  I also ordered the 90 percent roll, a roll I thought I could trust, and another roll that had various forms of yellow tail and a "orange sauce".  The yellow tail roll was fine, not amazing though for its price tag.  The bam bam roll was aweful. The dip was saltier than it used to be, and the soft shell crab had become oddly tough.   So sadly unless I really want some niku, I am over this place.  Good sushi in a desert is so elusive, I will continue my search.

This place was sold and has changed and am NEVER going back. It was by far the WORST service we've ever had.....and we are regulars who come from NW Las Vegas. We noticed the last time it was slower than normal, but we got our food. Today, we went with our 16 month as usual, and an hour later still no food. The place wasn't even busy! When we kept asking all they said was I'm sort it's coming. People who got there after us were either eating or already done. Then when I said we were leaving because my daughter needed to eat, they just started bring rolls out....not even her chicken teriyaki. Nothing was done or offered, aside an apology, so we said we were leaving. They didn't even try to stop us and make us pay. I'm in shock by this whole thing! I am so sad that the new owners are failing with what used to be one of, if not the best sushi places in town.

This is one of the best sushi restaurants I have been to anywhere. They have a wild collection of specialty rolls with some of the filthiest names on earth. The Spicy Ponzu is liquid heroin. drink the leftovers, you will never be the same! Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I admit it I'm a sushi snob!  I do not enjoy just any old plain sushi roll.   First it must be fresh (this goes without saying),  and second I like a little creativity in my rolls.  Well this place delivers!  The menu is extensive and full of lots of unique choices.   Pretty much everything I have tried is delicious and awesome.  Having tried many sushi restaurants in town I Love Sushi is without a doubt my favorite. The place is always hopping and the service is pretty good.  Some of my recommended rolls to try are Shaun's Special and Ryan's Special.

These guys are just amazing. Best sushi in Las Vegas in my opinion. Ambiance is great as well. They sure could spice it up w some good music and better outfits however. Not sure about socks and flip flops however. Looks not so comfortable but hey food this good i take it any day. Spicy hot edamame  is a good start. Good new creations on new food designs.

Hands down best sushi!!  The people who work there are efficient and very friendly. I was pleasantly surprised with the way the Last Call roll tasted, warm but cool, and is just incredible. My glass with green tea (cold) was never empty.

J'ai command√© des sushis √† cet endroit via Just Eat la semaine derni√®re et j'ai √©t√© grandement impressionn√© par la qualit√© de leurs sushis ainsi que leurs prix ridiculement bas pour un go√ªt aussi exceptionnel. Essayez I love Sushis, ils valent la peine!
Love this place! Yumm! Everything was really good! A little pricey but great! We really enjoyed our dinner!

I've dined here twice now and have been very happy with not only the sushi, but the service quality. The sushi selection is huge and has something for everyone. You can taste the quality and freshness in everything they offer. The waitresses are on top of their game, constantly refilling drinks and asking if you need anything else. There is never a time that they leave you waiting. Not only a great local sushi place, but a great sushi restaurant in general.

I've tried this place out once or twice more. Service was terrible, hardly friendly at all. The sushi is just not that good. I wish I loved this place but I can't stomach it. Extensive menu with crappy service and very mediocre food.

I'm a biiiiiig sushi lover and was really not so impressed. Sushi was pretty good I'd say, but not worth 16 bucks a roll.  All the sushi was overpriced and Overwhelmed by the sushi menu. I asked our waitress many questions and she couldn't answer half and the other half she was just look at me and walk away. Was impressed by the cucumber salad though!

**********Edit 4/28/08  just came here again over the weekend and i had to bump it to 5 stars!  the service was great and our waitress was so attentive.  Though i though i had given up forever on sushi, i was wrong.  They have some pretty inventive rolls  like, "who's your mama?" "who's your pimp?" "whats your ex-wife?" funny names like that.  The chefs are all young, which doesnt mean anything, but i cant hep but wonder if they helped in the sushi naming. The bento box lunch specials are very reasonable, stating at $7.95.  comes with salad, miso, rice, a little pouch of something filled with sweet rice, sweet tofu (i think), and two pot stickers. anyways...probably the only sushi place ill return to when i come here again.   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   good sushi, tempura and teriyaki.  i would be more elaborate, but for sushi night my mom wanted to go here and i didnt...so at no fault of their own, i was in no good mood.  I ordered tempura which was average.  My brother ordered teriyaki chicken, which he enjoyed very much.  My mom got sushi, and then we all split a spider roll, which i found to be very tasty.  minus a star because the service was so so...had to wait for some time for our drinks to be refilled, though it was a busy night and somewhat loud...

With sushi roll names like "Taste like My Ex", "Threesome", and "I Love Ass", this place is everything that Vegas is but is in the lovely neighboring city of Henderson. Yelp pro-tip, if you want to converse with your sushi chef and want real good food recommendations, I highly advise that you always take a seat at the sushi bar as opposed to a table if you can. We started off an assortment of nigiri as I tend to shy away from rolls as much as possible. Sake, Amaebi, Toro, Unagi, Uni, Ebi, Salmon Belly, etc. were all equally amazing. The Toro was like butter and according to my girlfriend, who rates sushi places based on how good their Uni was, was the best Uni that she has had since moving to Nevada. Because of the aforementioned names of rolls and the fact that they had like 60+ rolls/items on the menu, I had to try one. I ended up getting the "Kitchen Sink" and man was that a good choice. Literally a kitchen sink in terms of fishes in the roll and it tasted so bomb. Finally my girlfriend and I shared the baked lobster roll (no rice), which was literally all lobster and mushrooms and was also pleasantly surprisingly good as I have never had a lobster roll without rice before. All and all, it was a great experience and I will definitely come here again. Because, we were seated at the bar, I can't say too much about the service because our chef literally just hands us the food after we order. Yelp don't lie...this place is fire.

I'll be honest, I haven't tried much of the sushi here but I am a huge fan of their tuna poke. The tuna actually tastes marinated and not just doused in a soy sauce dressing. It's also got a bit of a spicy kick which I love!   I Love Sushi also has awesome spicy garlic edamame. Definitely can't go wrong with some deliciously seasoned edamame to share as a starter.  I usually come here for sake and beers, so I haven't explored their menu too much yet. My friends get the rolls and I've tried a piece here and there - not bad at all. I'll have to write a more detailed review when I really feast on their sushi.   Service is quick; the servers are Korean as they yell out orders in Korean to one another across the restaurant. The few times I've been here the servers have always been attentive. They just happen to check up on us when I need another sake or beer...  The menu items here are a little pricier but I don't mind for the taste and service. I'm sure I'll be back next time I'm craving their tuna poke and some sake!

We've never been disappointed at I Love Sushi. One of the best in town for quality. Well worth the extra dollars. I'll never stop eating there. Our family favorites are Tuna Tataki, Agedashi Tofu, baked lobster and butter garlic special.

This is the best sushi place I've found in Henderson so far. The quality is good and service are good. The rolls are fantastic but there are so many rolls on the sushi menu that I can't keep track of the ones i have/haven't had or the ones I like. They may want to skinny down the sushi menu just a little to cut down on confusion but I do enjoy the adventure! Perhaps a few daily special rolls would be cool.

The BEST sushi spot in Vegas, without a doubt, and I have had aloooot of sushi just about everywhere in the 13 years I've lived here. The fish is always FRESH, the service is exceptional, the food is always flavorful and consistently satisfying, and I could go on and on because everything is just EXCELLENT!   I Highly recommend I Love Sushi to all of my friends, family, co-workers and even complete strangers. It's just that good.   Speaking of which, I'll probably head over there tomorrow. I'm due for a screaming orgasm, nabeyaki udon and a kiss of fire roll. Yum!

So good.  So good.  Lots of vegetarian options, including a plain noodle udon with a vegetable broth, which I don't often find at sushi places.  I highly recommend both the inari and the tamago. A hidden gem far, far off the Strip.
Amazing sushi that is well priced and sure to please! Best spicy tuna handroll I have ever had!!!!

Hands down best sushi I've had in a long time.  Started with an O face -can't explain what it is but it's delicious.  The head some amazing Hamachi Belly.  Then had a flower blossom roll (which just blew my mind)  I'm from San Francisco and we have great sushi -but this place is in the top 5 for me.    If you want off the strip for a little bit come here!!!

We had ordered a udon and the chicken was so dry we couldn't eat it. The sushi was ok, but not great. The owner was raising his voice to the nice woman that helped us when we asked for some sort of discount for the chicken udon, since we didn't and couldn't eat it. In the past they have been ok, but pushy to get us out. We were very disappointed. This will be our last time we eat here.

My fianc√© and I have been going to I Love Sushi for 4 years now, ever since moving to the area. The service is always top notch and the sushi has always been fresh and amazing! Our favorites are the I Love My Ass, Burning Your Stomach, and Kiss of Fire! The Dynamite bakes dish is amazing as well if you feel like something hot.  On occasions when we've ordered out the food has always been packed well and complete! I would definitely recommend I Love Sushi to anyone!

I love... I Love Sushi!  We have been enjoying our neighborhood sushi bar for many years.  It is always packed - which is a tell-tale sign of how good the food is.  My favorites made special for me... Spicy Yellowtail with brown rice, a big dot of Sriracha and fresh jalapenos on each piece -yummm =)) I also love the Screaming Orgasm- no rice.  My kids have been eating yellowtail since they could eat solid food- thanks to I love sushi. I would highly recommend this sushi bar. Plus the owners and sushi chefs are really cool.

I never even really cared that much for sushi until my partner made me come here one night. The rest is history. This place is great. They typically get people in and out of there fairly quickly, so there is hardly any wait time. The house sake is awesome; it has a great kick to it. They have over 150 special sushi selections.

My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. The food is excellent and they are super fast in case you are ever in a rush.   Garlic Edamame to start is a must.  I personally love the Johnny Roll with no rice, the Candy Roll, and Hawaiian roll. The tuna nigiri is always fresh.

Being from LA where they have a lot of good sushi joints it tool a while for me to find something good in Vegas but here it is at last. I have been going to I Love Sushi for about a year now and never have i had a bad experience. Its always busy so you know the food is always fresh. My favorite roll is I Love My Ass and Spring Mt Roll. Another good item is the Screaming Orgasms and i usually ask them not to sear the tuna I think its a lot better that way.
I just went today for my daughters birthday and we had a sushi boat for 2 soooo much food sooo delicious!! Great service!! Definitely well priced !! A must for anyone who loves sushi!!

When a friend told me the name of the restaurant, I was a bit apprehensive...but the place was packed and we were seated quickly. Wow...the names of the rolls are fun and sex-themed. We shared some sashimi and a couple rolls and everything was great! I can't wait to go back! We had the Sex on The Beach roll, Lobster Roll, Tuna, Yellowtail and Albacore sashimi....everything was great!

Forget all the expensive sushi spots in town and go to I Love Sushi. Best sushi I have ever had in Vegas or anywhere else. The rolls are awesome and really unique...especially I Love My Ass, Dragon, Bam Bam...and the Screaming Orgasm rocks as well. They get very busy at the expected times but I've never had bad service here and I've eaten here at dozens of times. When I take people here from out of town the first thing they ask when they come back to visit is when we can go to I Love Sushi. Enough said.

By far one of the best sushi restaurants that I've been to. I don't care that the rolls are ultra-Americanized with crispy this and fried that. What it boils down to is Grade A raw fish and this place delivers! This place is consistent and since it opened has been serving some of the best sushi and sashimi in town. Added bonus that it's right down the street from my house.    The place went through some beautiful renovations in the last two years and is now even bigger. Bolder and more attractive colors. Some of my favorites: Flower roll, Ryan's roll, Spicy Yellowtail Sashimi with spicy ponzu sauce, Yellowtail comma, and the lunch bento box specials are solid as well.
I absolutely love that even when they are busy, I can still get a table and the sushi is always amazing.  I especially love their spicy tuna roll.

I usually don't venture down eastern because I live more west of Las Vegas, but I had some family staying at Homewood Suites down the road so we were searching for somewhere close to grab some dinner. They didn't know what they wanted and were just skimming through Yelp when we saw the reviews for this place. We got there just as they were opening and were greeted nicely and seated right away. The menu seemed like it had a lot of options and even for my aunt, who isn't a fan of seafood, she was able to find something for herself. We all seemed to try something we usually don't get just to see how we liked it and we were very pleasantly surprised at how delicious everything was. The staff was also very friendly and we loved how the ladies wore geisha outfits. We soon noticed that the place filled up quick so it must be a hit with others too! Thanks for the great service and even better food!

Our friends Nicole B. and Steven S. begged us to try I Love Sushi, so after 6 years of avoiding it, I finally went.  Eric R. didn't think it would be a good deal since it is a la carte, and I heard it was all about pornographic-named rolls, so I wasn't expecting much.  Our friends made reservations, which we thought was weird for a local a la carte sushi joint, but lo and behold, there was a crazy wait at 7 and we skipped all of that.  The servers wore kimonos, and this place is really big for a sushi restaurant - less activity at the bar and more at tables around it.  Our server was very friendly and efficient, and we had a private-esque booth.  I got iced green tea.  Steven S. does NOT love sushi, so he ordered a dinner bento with chicken and beef.  He got brown rice for a $1 charge.  Nicole B. got udon and the cherry blossom, a non-rice "roll" which is really a massive amount of soft shell crab chopped up and wrapped in avocado slices.  Eric R. got the rainbow roll, ikura sushi, and had a few pieces of my nigiri order.  I went for it, and appreciated some interesting selections here.  I got hamachi, sake, saba, amaebi, uni, salmon skin temaki, and a quail egg shooter.  When I got the first pieces, salmon and yellowtail, I immediately noticed the same problem Goyemon has - HOT rice, COLD fish.  YUCK!!!!  The sushi rice was hot and not really sushi rice, which is upsetting because 1) sushi is about the rice and 2) the mixed temperatures make everything taste weird.  Not okay.  The fish quality was fine enough, though the yellowtail was splitting apart at each seam so to speak.  I liked the salmon better.  The mackerel was cured just fine and covered with my fave vegetable, green onions.  The uni was okay.  The salmon skin handroll was stuffed, and it was prepared with gobo, kaiware, cucumber, and avocado without sauce, which was very good.  The quail egg shooter had 3 quail egg yolks, masago, green onion, and ponzu which was different and tasty.  I got the amaebi last.  The sushi was good and the fried heads were enormous and covered in tempura batter.  They were on top of shredded daikon and served with ponzu.  I was very full after all of this, and I am glad I tried it finally.  However, there is no excuse for poor rice when sushi is about rice, so I do not see myself returning.

Definitely the best sushi place here in Vegas. I've tried so many places out here and the quality is second to none. Service is great! My new regular spot. I can't believe someone gave it a one star because it's not all you can eat  you don't get this kind of quality at all you can eat.

This is my sister's favorite sushi place and I've been here a handful of times while visiting her. I wouldn't say they have the highest quality fish but their rolls are very tasty. And they have a large variety of them. All your favorites are on the menu plus quite a few that I think they made up. If you like trying maki with crazy combos then this place is for you. If you are more of a nigiri / sashimi sushi eater then I would probably go elsewhere.  PS they have a full bar and also make some pretty decent cocktails!
Delicious sushi, wide variety of rolls, fast service, fresh fish, little rice and cold mugs for your beer!!!

The three stars are for the food. Quality great but priced high.   As for the experience it's crazy in there the manager or owner I believe does not let staff do their job he is all up their butts and loud about it. It's like a father yelling at his children.  The staff is great there I'm sure the make great tips but they appear scared and uptight on busy nights so don't expect them to interact with u.  Good expensive sushi but not a calm fun place.. Very loud. It may just be me but the owner is nice to customers but stands up in front and is over bearing I want to leave before I even get to enjoy his food.. I have given the place multiple visits and yeah it's never different. Not my cup of tea! Maybe lunch is different but I want be finding out!
One of the best sushi places in Vegas. Love the oyster shooter.

What the ----! This place is CRAZY good. Seriously. I've had a lot of sushi around america, I live in New York City.. this place rocked my world. Not only was everything 5-star good, but they did it while closing for a party of 20. I was expecting some seriously bad sushi and they basically melted my face off. 5 star service, 5 star food.

Really reasonably priced and the fish is fresh. I have not been to another sushi restaurant on the strip, in Henderson or Las Vegas that tops I Love Sushi!   Try ... Rock and Roll and have them add mango. I also opt for no mayo in sauce. Yellowtail and Jalape√±o. Sean Special with soy paper, brown rice and no cream cheese.  ALWAYS a crowd pleaser! Everyone I take loves this place.  Frankie and Edwin are awesome!!!

Absolute favorite place for sushi.  Visited 3 times and loved it every time.  No shortage of options, everyone will find something they like.  Best experience is at the bar where you can banter with the chefs.  Meat-less, rice-less, fried, raw, saucy, plain, all kinds of options and everything is good. Kiss of Fire, Bam Bam, Sushi Nachos, Screaming Orgasm, Who's Your Momma, and more and more.

Sushi was fresh.  Portion was acceptable.   Nice ambience.  I am extremely pleased with the service.  The server(s) kept checking back on us multiple times.  When I visit my friend in Las Vegas again, I would definitely come again.

This place is amazing.  Every year in August when I'm in LV for a weekend convention-like outing about 50 of us go there late afternoon and spend a couple of hours sharing their amazing rolls.  How they manage to handle such a large rowdy bunch, I have no idea, but we love it.    The rolls are unusual and very yummy, the sushi and sashimi is also good but it's the rolls that make this place unique.
Always a great place for sushi.  They don't have AYCE.  The lettuce wrap sushi is my favorite.  The bento is reasonable and a good amount.  The service is always good and the place is clean.
Service is awful!  their sushi is wonderful but they're overwhelmed with work and not enough staff

The reviews for this place have to be fake. The place is dirty, service was slow and very polite or attentive almost as if you owe them something for going there. Additionally the rolls are sloppy, too much rice and sauces. There are much better places in Vegas to go then this place!

Sushi is decent here, not the best in the city, but tasty nonetheless. Takes a bit long for take out even on slow days at lunch, but you get quite a bit of food for the dollar. I ordered the tempura special and it was a bit greasy, but despite the mounds of food I always get through the meal and walk away feeling better with it in my tummy, so if you're ever along the way, not a bad place to stop for a bite.

Best damn sushi in Henderson, if not Vegas.   I could eat the garlic tuna sushi by the bucket load. I guess I would if I were a seal. But I'm not. So I eat it here. One delicious, melt-in-your mouth, piece at a time.

The sushi was pretty good. I'm quite surprised by the over the top reactions to this place. The service was just fine. The miso soup was good, and the salad was also quite yummy. I got the Yellowtail roll. The rolls were very big, and were delicious. The presentation was also very nice. I went in expecting poor quality sushi, but was pleasantly surprised. I would definitely return here.
This is a great neighborhood/chain place to find good sushi. Prepare to be amused!
This place is amazing! By far my favorite sushi place in henderson/las Vegas! The owner James is awesome and very personable! Great environment and service! The screaming orgasm is AMAZING!!!!

Service was impeccable. There  are a lot of options for sushi rolls but most of them are pretty similar. The sushi itself was a bit overdone for me (as in too complicated which I think masks the quality, or lack thereof, of the fish). Mochi was yummy!  Overall sushi was just ok, better if you like a ton of stuff piled on and tempura shrimp in them.
I Love Sushi is the name, and reflects our feelings about this great restaurant. Its a 2-3 times per month habit.   Excellent management and exceptional service, always.

Really love this place. Definitely on the pricey side but the flavors are really great. New owner is very nice.  Favorite dishes are definitely he screaming orgasm and the kiss of fire roll. Unfortunately they don't offer all you can eat:(

I Love Sushi is one of those local spots that are as good as it gets. It is not the flashiest or most expensive and it doesn't have a famous chef. It's just quality, consistent, and delicious. I didn't think I was going to give a 5 to anywhere for a while but when I started to try and pick it apart I couldn't really say anything bad about it. They are fast with their service, but not too fast. The dishes are always delivered exactly the same. The food quality is always very high. The fish is very fish. Prices are reasonable.  If there was a 4.5 stars I would have considered that one just because of the decorations. It is nice, but based on the volume and quality of the place, it could use a little facelift to reflect the true quality of who it is. It's not bad, its clean, its just a little old and tired looking. But that would not distract from going.  If I want American style sushi, this is the spot. If I want more authentic Japanese sushi I always go to Miko's Izakaya. Two totally different styles. Both best in class.
My absolute favorite Sushi place in Vegas. Grand Canyon roll is a sure bet every time. Screaming Orgasm is a must have too.

I want to say I've been here three times between the end of last year up to this past May. The good part is that every trip was great! I was really, really skeptical when my co-workers informed me of a "good" sushi joint in Anthem, so it took them a while to convince me to take a trip here. I'm definitely glad they did.   What's different from other sushi restaurants is probably the most important. I like that they have several, really delicious, no-rice sushi options. Very cool for those that want to watch their carb intake (diabetics!). Also, this is a non-AYCE sushi joint. Not everyone's cup of tea, but I think that attributes to the freshness and quality of fish.  My favorite no-rice dishes are the Spring Mountain Roll (spicy soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, avocado, radish sprout, eel, wrapped in rice paper, topped with spicy mayo and sriracha) and the Screaming Orgasm (tuna sashimi or seared, lots of julienned daikon, sauces galore, tobbiko, green onions). The Spring Mountain Roll is probably my overall favorite sushi roll. The last time I was there, the chefs gave us a bowl of tempura jalape√±o. Not something I would ever order, but they were so good! And not terribly spicy either.   My only gripe was the terrible quality of the Ikura on my last visit. It was not good. But, to their defense, I hardly find really delicious Ikura or Uni in the valley. Other than that, it's just really busy during dinner. Service is usually pretty good, no complaints, but nothing amazing.  Overall, great place for a sushi fix!

Service was great... I ordered a few rolls but my favorite was "screaming orgasm" lol names are a lil kinky but hey it's VEGAS... not a place for the prudes ;-) it's a little pricy for a little bit of food, that's why I gave it 4 stars. I'll be back for my *Screaming Orgasm* for sure.

I have been eating at I love sushi for years.  They have really fresh fish that makes the seafood experience overall... non threatening.  Pretty much everyone I've ever taken loves it.  It can get expensive if you're hungry (or in my case, typically thirsty!) but it is a great place to do sushi at.  And, their sushi menu is actually descriptive.  The sushi chefs are a blast and almost every time I go, the owner is diligently making sure the customers are getting stellar service.   Their cucumber salad in usually excellent and they have a full restaurant menu for your non sushi savvy pals.  My favorites are the baked green mussel, kiss of fire, and the sundevil.

Love this place!!!  Talk about a HUGE sushi menu.  You can go multiple times without trying everything at this place.  I have only lived in Vegas now for a little over 2 months, but thus far I have yet to find another Sushi joint that I like better.  The only place this place is getting 4 stars and not 5 is because I think it is a bit pricy for what you get.  The service was also mediocre both times I have been here.  Besides that I don't think you can go wrong here.  Tip: The Poke Salad is amazing!  The screaming orgasm is also, well....orgasmic.

I love sushi and I love this place! Service is good most of the time, when it gets busy sometimes it's hard to get their attention, but that doesn't stop me from eating here as often as possible. I have never had a bad meal here, always on point. I've been going to this place for years, f*cking love this place...can you swear on yelp?..

For some reason this place gets good reviews but every time I have gone to this location my Tuna was always "mushy", not firm, sweet nor fresh tasting in the least. Coming from the Bay Area where you can find "fresh", I can tell right away that the Tuna here isn't the freshest from the mushy consistency.   I will never go back and have found other Sushi Restaurants on Eastern that blows this place out of the water.
Hands down best locals sushi n in town.  I have been coming here for years... screaming orgasm is worth the drive from Summerlin!

I Love Sushi is really convenient! There is always seating and the food is good. Now, its not top quality by any means, BUT! I have never had a bad experience here, I even ordered their party platters for my 25th birthday.   The most recent visit to I Love Sushi was as per usual, very satisfying, I had the all you can eat menu, and ordered spicy tuna, spicy salmon, spicy avocado, chicken teriyaki, and white tuna sushi. The rolls have enough meat on them that I dont feel like I am filling up on rice. The seaweed is not over powering, and the rice is moist, and has never been dry,   The Chicken Teryaki is very salty, be warned!   The servers are very nice, although their English isnt great, so sometimes you have to repeat things. All in all, I will go back, and recommend it to my friends,

I have been going to this sushi place since I was in middle school.  Being young I was never into raw fish, until I ate here.  I fell in love with sushi here and this place will forever be one of my favorite sushi place to go to regularly.    I Love Sushi does not offer All you can eat because of the quality of their fish.  The Cherry Blossom and the Screaming Orgasm are my favorite rolls to get there.  The sashimi and nigiri is undoubtedly one of the freshest you can find in Vegas.  You will not be disappointed in coming here.
This is one of my favorite place to eat. Friendly employees, great service and food always so good.

Best sushi in Las Vegas and that includes the strip and all the fancy places and this place is in a random strip mall in Henderson. We eat here almost weekly and always get the same 4 or 5 rolls and then one new one. Have had almost everything on the menu and the fish is always fresh and everything is great. Favorites include Screaming O, I Love My Ass and Bam Bam. Always busy so be prepared to wait on Friday, Saturday and Sunday but it always moves fast or you can sit at the sushi bar.

I Love Sushi is our go to restaurant for sushi. I have never had anything from there that wasn't great. The monkey roll is unique and very tasty. The service is good and no matter how busy they are, we always get right in. But most of the time, they are pretty busy. If you want to best sushi in Henderson, check this place out.

Soo yeah I think I'm in LOVE! Ummm yah hands down best sushi spot I've tried. And I will never go anywhere else!!! The rolls were so flavorful, there wasn't a lot of rice packed in them and there of plenty of fish. The poki salad was great! Our waitress was nice and friendly, I think her same was Lisa :-) I wish I could have tried other stuff on the menu but I was stuffed. Oh yesss for dessert get the mochi combo :-) anyway I will be back soon! LOVED IT!
Did not live up to my expectations! Jackpot roll was highly recommended and supposedly their best roll, but it tasted like a basic roll. If u want real sushi, head down to SD:)
good place good portion sizes and good price. I reccomend takeout, and the dynamite roll!

I was skeptical of I love Sushi because of all the mixed reviews online but took a chance and went there.  The AYCE menu had a fair number of options. The lunch AYCE was $15.99 for Friday. The sushi was fresh and very flavourful. The service was also great. Even though we reached around 2:15pm and lunch hours end at 3pm, we were able to order two rounds. They even came and told us when the last round for ordering was, in case we lost track while enjoying the food. The calamari rings were also really fresh.  All in all, it was a great AYCE experience. We have finally found a reasonably priced AYCE delicious sushi place not too far from home after many months of searching!
Love this place!! Fast service and always friendly.  High quality sushi with a lot if variety.  I got the love boat for 2people and it was a lot of good! Perfect for sharing.

Great sushi spots with a huge variety of rolls, with clever names to boot. Fast, friendly service, reasonable prices, worth a visit! 90% wood roll, mistake roll, pink sex on the beach roll (had mussels, lol),and rock and roll were our delicious choices, all REALLY yummy. If you are looking for great sushi, this spot will get the job done! Highly recommend it! Large dinning area, no outdoor seating, plenty of parking in lot. Nice drink menu too.

Wow... I cannot even begin to describe how fresh and amazing this sushi is here at I Love Sushi! I've tried so many sushi restaurants here in vegas and this one has changed my view about sushi... The only negative thing I have to say is that it is expensive, cheapest roll was $9 and they don't have all you can eat... But since the service and sushi were outstanding, the bill doesn't even matter!  I'll definitely be back !

I love the atmosphere here - it's always rockin busy so you know the fish has to be fresh!. The sushi bar is huge and the booths are big and private. All the waitresses are friendly and very attentive. They wear stylish colorful Kimonos! It is absolutely family friendly - this is by far my favorite sushi place in all of Vegas / Henderson! People travel from all over town to eat here! They have very sexy & fun names for their sushi rolls! Coldest beers in town - large sapporro - fav!! My favorite rolls you have to order:  #1 Screaming Orgasm - Tuna with radishes that are cut like angel hair - good for low carb orders! #2 Kiss of Fire ( It's a little Spicy- if you prefer not spicy - just say no sauce- the little sliver of jalapeno on top is fresh so not very spicy) #3 Johnny Roll No Rice - Refreshing! #4 Sushi Nachos - Unlike anything you have ever had! Pure deliciousness! #5 Anthem roll - traditional Calif roll with spicy tuna on top. #6 Ryan's Special or Double D #7 Caterpillar Roll  This place is busy from open to close! Call ahead to get a reservation!
Service was FAST and polite! . We were in the mood for some late night sushi. Got here at 10:15, aye two rolls by 10:28. That's fast. So yummy.

I come here very rarely because the lunch specials are notably cheaper. But this visit will be my LAST. Every experience I've had I've dealt with really bad costumer service from all employees.   Today we had sat down to eat and the women working barely acknowledged us, forgot half of the things to bring out. Yelled over our heads as another costumers came in. Then at the end of our meal she decided to tell us that the interact machine was not currently working and had my sister run out to the nearest atm.  Very unprofessional. The food is OK not the best of cheaper sushis I've had. Not somewhere I recommended to anyone and definitely will NOT be returning.

The most notable aspect of this restaurant is its extensive (almost overwhelmingly long) menu and it's a cheap prices. The service was decent (not super fast but not slow either), and the food was average as far as sushi goes. I ordered the general Tao chicken and it was fairly good and not too oily (good portion size) and my partner ordered the vegitarian set. She also said it was ok. I think for the both of us it came to less than 25 bucks including tax and tip which is great. See pictures.

Favorite sushi spot in Vegas! The owner is awesome, the staff in so kind and efficient. I make it a point to swing by, even if it's just for a quick roll, when I'm on this side of town.  I've devoured almost everything on the menu and have yet to come across something that's not delicious!

This place was super busy and yet we got seated right away. I'm not going to lie I'm not a sushi person, but all of my family is so ya... They loved loved loved their sushi everyone that got a roll was so happy.  I got the Chicken Yakisoba it was soooooo good! I was very happy with my dish.   Our waitress was so cute, nice and very attentive. I loved the atmosphere of this place. The family absolutely found their favorite sushi place!

It's a party in your mouth.   I LOVELOVELOVELOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!! This is the best sushi I've ever had in my life. Everything about I Love Sushi is amazing, the sushi, miso soup, the restaurant, the menu, the sexual/hilarious names they think up for the sushi rolls (Tastes Like My Ex-Girlfriend, Screaming Orgasm, I Love My Ass, etc..), the waitresses, the chefs, the bar, the booths, the tables, the service, the prices, everything! I dream about their sushi and plum saki everyday. The softness of the rice, the way they pack in the many versatile ingredients that go into each roll, how at first bite you just sit back and realize that you've been missing out on a big chunk of life in food world. Mmm.. I can still taste it in my mouth.  The restaurant is lit just right to be romantic and bright enough to see what you're eating, who you're talking to, and occasionally check out the hot chef with the Japanese flag as a bandana behind the sushi bar (i love you, super sexy chef). The service is phenomenal, everyone working there is Japanese, even the waitresses, and I had to keep from laughing when our graceful, polite waitress who looks like she's never said a cuss word in her life repeated our order to us, "2 Screaming Orgasms, One roll of Tastes Like My Ex Girlfriend, one Ricky Roll and one roll of I Love My Ass with plum saki". It still makes me laugh just thinking about it.  I once drove from L.A. to Henderson, Nevada just to eat here. My absolute favorite roll is the Ricky Roll. I give this restaurant a bajillion stars, this place will definitely get you some, and I'm gonna dream about their sashimi tonight.

Love their sushi! They have such a large selection so you can always try new rolls each time you visit. They do not have all you can eat but I think that's because of the high quality of all of their rolls. I love any of their spicy rolls, they taste so good! The service is also up to par. You never wait long for anything you have ordered and bring your check promptly at the end of the meal. This is one of my go to sushi places in Las Vegas.

Hands down my favorite sushi spot in town. Great services, great food, great atmosphere. Everyone I take to ILS falls in love with the place, as I did when I walked in for the first time last year. I'll drive as far as I need to have sushi @ILS

Never fails! This is my FAVORITE sushi place in all Las Vegas, and I have been to MANY! The chefs are all very friendly and very fast!  My all time favorite rolls are Bonzai, Double D, Joe Special, Jackpot Special, and Kiss of Fire! I wish my stomach was big enough to have these all EVERY TIME! I absolutely love this place!

I've always been a big fan of I Love Sushi, but I haven't been here in a while.  In the meantime, I've eaten sushi all over Vegas and discovered that I Love Sushi isn't all that it's cracked up to be.  The sushi is good.  I love their oyster shooters, but their 2000 different rolls all taste the same to me.  They rely WAY too much on sauce and often I want to yell at them that simple is good too!  A nice elegant simple roll can go a long way.  The service is always great.  Sometimes I wonder if the servers are really Japanese or they just fake a thick and heavy Japanese accent to go with their beautiful Japanese costumes and restaurant decor.  The one thing I really like about I Love Sushi is the ambiance.  It is always loud and rowdy in there, unlike many sushi restaurants.  You feel like you're somewhere "happenin", which I love when I'm eating out.  As far as the food goes, like I said, it's just ok.  If  you are the type of person who only eats sushi and sashimi, the place is great!  But if, like me, you like a roll or two, I'd check out other spots.

Yikes?  What happened to authentic Japanese Sushi?  If you like the litany of sexy body parts and earthly dragon named sushi that are extreme variations of traditional sushi, then this is the place for you.  I prefer more traditional and authentic sushi and so it is hard really to taste the flavors of the sushi in a restaurant like this because the sauces and fried stuff and mixture is kinda overpowering.  But hey, I like to have ketchup on my steak once in a while, and so, I have come here several times and will come again as it ain't bad, but it really isn't real Japanese food, it is blended to the American taste.....

I've always heard of this place but never tried it. We came in during dinner time and they were packed. We were seated at the bar. Our sushi chef was friendly and nice.  We typically like to eat sashimi/nigiri. The selection of special fish are limited. Our go to is uni and it was nice and fresh here. We ordered the toro (fatty tuna) and it melted in your mouth. Other than that, everything else here was standard. The fish is fresh here because they stay busy. We also tried the oyster shooter and the uni shooter. I really didn't like it because it was salty, maybe it was the ponzu sauce? We had one roll, I think it was the Joe's roll? It was good.  I don't think this will be my go to place but I would come back.

Great food and great service! Our family loves this place. We have some non sushi eaters so it's great that this place offers so much more then just sushi and it's all been very good. My kids love the bento box dinners!

I got a dancing eel roll and a Mexican roll. The first one was pretty good, but the second one wasn't what I thought it would be - it was basically a California roll with spicy crab meat instead of normal crab meat. I thought it would be real crab meat, but I guess I was wrong. The dancing eel roll had very crispy tempura inside, and the top had some poke-like tuna mix, avocado, and eel. Not bad! I waited for about 10-15 minutes for my food; this place gets busy! Rolls are pretty small for the very high prices; not sure whether it's worth it. After two rolls and down about $25, I could definitely still eat more!

Eat here regularly because of the quality and service. Even on crowded Friday nights you get seated ina reasonable time. High quality sushi and the 'boats' are an amazing value, you will never leave hungry or wanting more.

I don't know if it's the best sushi I've had since we moved in Vegas almost 8 years ago, but it's up there certainly.  This is a large restaurant with several ways to dine.  You can sit at the sushi bar, there are numerous tables throughout the restaurant, and there are booths that offer a more private experience.  Service was decent, but we had to wait a long time for our check.  This was annoying as it was lunch time on a weekday, we clearly weren't looking for a 2 hour lunch.  The rolls and sashimi were good.  The famous screaming orgasm wasn't as good as I was expecting, given its reputation.  The yellowtail and salmon sashimi were excellent.  Buttery pieces of fish that had excellent flavor.  Good quality and prepared properly.  Decent beer selection.  We will definitely be back.

A local place with one of the best rolls I have had...the "burning your stomach roll" It's extremely spicy, but one of the best I have tasted. And the sushi is always fresh. Service has always been great...the only minor complaint would be sometimes the sushi doesn't come out all together..that could be annoying if you are in a larger group and some people don't have their food. But other than that a great place and prices are great as well.   The menu is huge, so it could take you a while too decide.
Great lunch with my mom. Excellent service, excellent food, decent prices. Recommended!

We were seated immediately on a busy evening, nice environment, incredible sushi, and great service. The servers dress as geishas, the only thing that bummed me out was that it was not all you can eat, however, they compensated by having a tremendous menu. Highly recommend!

It's the very first time I tried uni shooter. Oh, it's so yummy. And my friend tried scallop shooter which was so good as well. I was disappointed that they don't have kobe beef. And their chef didn't have any communication with customers even we sat at the sushi bar. But that's fine. We did enjoy the sushi here.

This place is by far one of the best sushi places in all of Las Vegas! The waitresses are all really nice and are able to help with almost anything. The owner is a nice guy and gets to know his clients very well. Only thing about him is that we always get the vibe that he tries to rush everyone out.  Anyways! Onto the sushi. It's amazing and great quality. Some must try items: Lisa Handroll (my all time favorite!!!), something wrong #15, and Tuna Karai. They are all amazing. So amazing that I just stuffed my face and forgot to take pictures until everything was gone except part of the something wrong haha.  Pricing is reasonable, but can get pricey depending on what you get. Go check them out. P.s. there's no all you can eat, if that's what you're looking for.

IMHO This is the best sushi in town. Fresh. Creative. Worth the wait. My fav is the Joes Special. The Service is sometimes rushed. But to be expected when every table is turning every hour all dinner time long. I'm not a fan of the cramped waiting area. We learned to get there early. Before 6. Enjoy!

Came to this place on a friends recommendation.  The restaurant is nice. The decor was a bit dark but the waitresses all wore kimonos which were really pretty.  They are friendly and nice.   Between three people, we ordered the large screaming orgasm, Gyoza, Rick and roll and the fire(?) roll.  The Gyoza was fried and came with ponzu dipping sauce. The outside was crunchy but the inside a little mushy. I have had better but it's not bad. The rock and roll was by far our favorite. Salmon yellowtail tuna and crab meat wrapped in cucumber. It also came with a sauce but I just ate it plain with a slice of lemon. Very fresh and hits the spot. The fire roll not only looked like Mexican food, but tasted like it too. Too saucy and tart, couldn't really taste the fish. The screaming orgasm was drowning in sauce but it was quite tasty. 10 pieces of seared tuna for 16 bucks. We were so overwhelmed by sauce that we decided to order one more roll, the eel one with the spicy tuna. I really liked that roll. I got the fresh fish taste from the spicy tuna and the sweetness from the eel.   Overall I would come back again but I have had better for the price. Over all everything was 70 bucks all together.

This is one of my favorite places to get sushi in town. I have been going here for years and love that there is no "all you can eat" option - just a diverse menu full of high-quality fish. The chefs are trained well and present the dishes in a nice fashion. I love that they give you free edamame and cucumber salad when you sit at the bar. My favorite rolls are the Tempura Roll and Japanese Lasagna. I ordered the Boom Boom Nipple Special last night and it was pretty good, however I was not really into the fish mix tempura that went along with that. Other than that, I always have a superb experience dining here. Highly recommend!

Absolutely awesome sushi! Best in Las Vegas!   Wait staff not 100% great in customer service...sometimes language barrier.  Little pricey...no AYCE, but they know ppl will pay extra for their rolls cause they are that good!

This place looked more Chinese with the red color of choice lol.  The servers wear wrap around simplified shiny kimono and greet you the usual Irashaimase.  Their menu. They have a ton of rolls . Tons. It overwhelming and confusing since the the ingredients are all the same .  They should lessen the variety and stick to pictures menu so one can see how it looks like.  Their nigiri sushi are simple for a 4 dollar plus a plate.  But I can say their tuna that night was amazing . It just melted .
Great Food. Great Management. Great price. Owner James was very accomodating and nice. He came over to introduce himself and provides many complimentary items. Thanks! Better than any buffet Sushi.

I'm not the biggest sushi eater in Las Vegas, but when I go, I do love, "I Love Sushi!"  Totally fun place with lots of energy.  The food is very fresh, and sushi chefs are entertaining!  Highly Recommend!

Why I haven't written a review yet here is beyond me. Maybe it's because of the great conversation I have here that I forget, or the full happy belly that leaves me in such a euphoric state that I can't bear to type. Well whatever the case I am writing it now. This place has such a great atmosphere and amazing sushi rolls everything, every time I come I can't believe it. I'm never ever ever disappointed l. The staff is friendly and the sushi is delightful what more can you want!? Get here early on the weekends because it's usually slammed packed. Def a local spot. Oh and by the way SIMON IS AWESOME! Such a kind spirit and a pleasure to be around. Always makes my time at I Love Sushi even better!

This place was not as delicious as I remember it being. This time my friend and I sat away from the sushi bar, so it was not as entertaining--with the flying fish fillets and sake shots--as last time. We also sat by the door, which made the dining environment chillier than I'd like. Overall the food was good. I had the noodle soup and my friend ordered some elaborate sushi roll and dinner meal. Service was speedy and attentive.

I used to do the AYCE sushi, but since my first time at I Love Sushi, it's hard to go back. This place is my #1 sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. It is always busy, but it's because the food and service here is out of this world. Great and fresh quality of fish and the sushi chefs are friendly. Tip: ask the sushi chefs to create a roll of their own, you'll find that there are some great rolls not on the menu.

Finally got a chance to eat here. It's across town, so you know how it is for us old folks to get around. I liked a lot of things about this place: The service was good, I was seated right away, and there was a large selection of sushi rolls. The only thing that I wasn't crazy about, was that there was no all-you-can-eat deals. If I wanted to fill my belly at this place, it probably would have cost me in excess of $100. Now, this is partly my fault, because I eat every meal as if I'm going to the chair, but there are lots of other sushi places which offer AYCE, and the quality is on par with this place. If this place offered AYCE, it would get 5 stars, hands down.

The food was great. When I go to a new sushi place I always order a spicy tuna roll to get a feeling for the quality of tuna that's being used and Friday nights are usually the best time to do that as many places get their last shipment of fish for the weekend on Friday ( local places in Nevada ) it's was fresh, delicious and well seasoned. The service was over the top even though the place was packed to the gills. We had I LOVE MY ASS ROLL as well which was awesome ! Will be back ASAP. Locals make the drive and try this place.
The name says it all!! I DO love sushi!  Great staff and I love to seeing the owner there! Favorite roll?? Well, there are many to choose from with cute names!! But my fav? The MC roll...

If you know the difference between a mexican cooking Italian food or an italian cooking mexican then you'll appreciate that Koreans really can't make authentic Japanese. To non-Japanese you may think this is good sushi but everything from the seaweed salad, green tea, and sushi are far from true, real Japanese in taste and texture. Basically to a Japanese person raised in Japan. This food is terrible. Like comparing Taco Bell to a real Taqueria. Don't be fooled find the real thing.

I have been wanting to try this place for a while. When it was sushi date night with my boyfriend, I suggested this place other than my normal place. The sushi we ordered was so good! I loved each roll we tried. I loved the atmosphere and the service was awesome. I am definitely coming back as soon as possible.

An inexpensive gem in an otherwise expensive mine.   The menu is beyond intimidating, as their are nearly 100 plus rolls for you to choose from. I sat staring bleakly and relegated my dinner order to throwing darts, hoping that in the end my buyer's remorse wouldn't kick in. The plain spicy tuna was "so-so"; the Washington role was packed full of fresh, melt-in-your-mouth salmon and the Sun Devil role nearly made me change my underwear. Personally, one of the most delicious rolls I've had anywhere.  Service is very quick and non obtrusive. Seating was immediate on a Sunday evening and the restaurant was clean. The most obvious thing I noticed was the sheer volume of sushi chefs (nearly 10) pumping out quick, quality plates at a moment's notice. Overall, a pretty outstanding place. Price was decent (about $40 for 3 rolls) and there were no specials.

Their sushi choice is mediocre at best. The last time I was here, I was flipping through the menu several times because I was having difficulty with choosing anything that seemed remotely appetizing. I did choose the Threesome Special roll, though, which was actually pretty good. However, their sushi is too pricey considering the quality of food that they have. I wouldn't mind paying $13 for a roll that's not a special at a high-end sushi restaurant, but not at I Love Sushi. I will only come to I Love Sushi if friends want to meet up with me there, but other than that, there are better sushi places in Henderson.
Excellent, as always. We eschewed the sushi today, and explored the rest of the menu. David had the yakisoba, and i had the tonkatsu. Very, very good!

I love ,I Love Sushi in the Henderson location ! I've been going there for years since I live nearby.The food is always fresh and consistent !! Always !! The price is right and not overly expensive! Love the wait staff and overall the ambiance of the  Japanese restaurant !Whenever I go there I feel like I'm back in Japan.The waitstaff are so very nice and efficient.I have no complaints whatsoever, the owner of this place should be very proud of  their employees! Five stars for this place!
Always fresh and consistently good. The Screaming Orgasm and Joes Special are my favorites!

Finally.  After trying about half a dozen sushi joints in town, I think my wife and I found one we will go back to regularly.  I Love Sushi gained instant credibility because a.) it was actually crowded when we went there (on a Monday no less) and b.) they didn't have some incredibly priced ala carte menu to entice you into their "all you can eat" offering.  I think my wife and I would each get our rolls again (I Love Sushi roll, The Mistake roll, some roll that had the word "nipple" in it, and another one I forget the name of).  The highlight for me was the sashimi.  For $5 the portion was great.  Three very thick pieces of salmon and incredibly dark/fresh tuna.  The salmon was delicious and maybe the best salmon sashimi I've had, same for the tuna.  In the words Ahhhnold, "I'll be back."

I have known about this place for 3 years but never came because the signage didn't look all that great in the random plaza.   However,  this place is really nice inside,  the staff are wonderful,  and the food is delicious!  If you're out degree fence about coming here, you won't be disappointed!

Best sushi in Las Vegas, hands down! The salmon nigiri is our favorite - the fish is so fresh and will literally melt in your mouth like butter. Bam Bam special is also delicious, along with the dancing eel roll. The owner is also very helpful and nice, he always recognizes us and says hello. I highly recommend!!

Henderson is such an interesting place - that being said if you're there and want Sushi, they won't disappoint.  Be aware if you bring young children here because a bunch of the rolls are named after sexual positions and experiences lol. Good place to spend a birthday for sure :)

When I'm at work and my wife messages me "I want a screaming orgasm" then I know it's time for some I Love Sushi.  I was in the mood for some sushi too and the Screaming Orgasm along with some Uni, Yellowtail, Unagi, Salmon and beer sounded like a perfect way to end the day of chaos and stress following what happened in Las Vegas on Sunday.  We came here and we were immediately seated and offered drinks.  We then followed it up with some great food and a great time.  It was the perfect way to not think about anything but food and beer for a hour or so.  This is definitely one of the best sushi spots in Vegas and I very much recommend it to anyone who hasn't tried it yet.
This has to be one of the best sushi places you can possibly eat at. The sushi is fresh and delicious.

Quite possibly the best sushi I've ever had and such a great environment. Everything is so fresh and unique on the menu and of all the times I've gone I've never had a poor experience. The waitresses are great and remember the customer faces and keep me going back! I would highly recommend it to all.  Not only does I love sushi have amazing sushi, but they have great appetizers and other options such as chicken and udon for those who are not fans of sushi. They're desserts are to die for as well!

Hands down my favorite sushi in Henderson, maybe even all of Vegas. Service is always pretty good and they have a lot of great sushi chefs who are very friendly when you sit at the bar. They do some really great no rice rolls such as the Johnny roll and Spring Mountain. Its not all you can eat so in my opinion there seafood quality is a little higher. Overall really great sushi spot. 4.5/5

First of all let me just say that I'm a huge foodie and I love to try new restaurants. I love sashimi and being from Hawaii I've had some of the freshest fish ever, well this place comes really close to it. I love all they're creative sushi rolls, sashimi is super fresh, and they have some good entrees as well. The owners is there almost every night he's very welcoming and they always give you great costumer service, by starting you off with a warm towel to wipe your hands to complimentary cucumber salad. I love this this place and I've been eating here for the past eight years, and it's never a disappointment.
Had the edamame and california rolls. Good food. Ok service.

They don't have any sort of happy hour here, but they give you tons of food for the price.  Their lunch combos are great.. $8-9 for a two-item combo bento box.  I usually get it with Tempura, and Chicken Katsu.  It also comes with Miso, Salad, Egg, Rice, Beancurd Sushi.  I know I'm leaving something out, but I've never seen such a huge bento box.  The dinner combos go up a little bit in price (I think it's $13-14 dollars), but they give you about twice as much Tempura, as well as cucumber salad, regular salad, gyoza, some sort of Tempura fried rice ball.  Again, tons of food for the price.  Another good thing to order here are the teppanyaki plates for about $14.  My girlfriend usually gets the Ribeye one, and it's pretty much just tons of meat, zucchini and onions.  They're served with Ponzu, and another sauce to dip the meat/veggies in.  They also come with Miso, and salad.
Best sushi in Las Vegas. Screaming Orgasm and kiss of fire...yummm!!! I won't eat sushi anywhere else

This has got to be one of the top places in the country for sushi (not just in Henderson, NV)! I have been here several times.   We were a group of 5 and we ordered it up! We had Burning My Stomach, Boom Boom Nipple Special, Kitchen Sink, Spicy Tuna Roll, and Deep Fried Cheesecake.  I'm know I'm missing some things. We shared everything.   That Deep Fried Cheesecake is everything! It tasted like a delicious funnel cake, lol.  And there's something to eat for everyone. Even if you are not a "sushi" person.   By the way, you can tell they get creative with naming their meals, lol. The names will make you laugh and think "I can't believe they named it that!"  Service is fantastic! The staff is so active, quick, and friendly. This is a great place for family and/or friends to have a great time.   Prices: I would say it's moderate ($$).  They make everything at time of order. Groups are always coming through here because they can easily share the food and share the bill. ;-)  If it was too expensive, I would think most locals wouldn't be coming  on a nightly busy.   Location: it's located in a shopping plaza near Sunridge Heights.  I love sushi! What move can I say, but just go and check them out!

Sadly after my husband I both got food poisoning I have to take off a couple stars. If you like rolls - this still is the best place in Vegas to go ! Their cooked food is decent as well. If you're a sashimi/nigiri fan I would take your business down the street to En.

I LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH. Don't even read the reviews just go!!!!! Everything is so fresh and perfectly put together, just well balanced. My boyfriend and I come here once a week and it's our favorite sushi spot ever. Our favorites are: -flower roll -sun devil -one night stand -double D -alligator roll

Not the best sushi I've had but it's ok. ILS serves typical Vegas-Korean style junky rolls with quality ingredients, but are just covered in waaaay too much sauce.   Also, and maybe it's just me, but I'm so sick of all the dumb roll names. Really? Does every sushi joint need to serve "orgasm sauce?" One Yelper described this as "ingenious." Wrong "I" word--more like "idiotic." And there's like a million selections with just one ingredient varying in each. It took me a solid 15 minutes to order two rolls to go. Too much work.   I'd rather go somewhere else without the insane lists and just get a good freaking roll not drowning in a mayo-based bodily-fluid referenced sauce.

This place is the reason why I started liking sushi... I tried it out a couple months ago and now I go back AT LEAST once a week. My favorites are"I Love My Ass" and "Triple X." The staff is friendly and the manager is always around to make sure everyone is happy with their dining experience. Nowhere else satisfies my sushi cravings except I Love Sushi!

The fish really is incredibly fresh and consistently high-quality.  The price is also very reasonable.  Also the rolls are, over all, pretty traditional.   Overall, I like the place.  It's a good neighborhood joint.  It is a great place that will never let you down.

Gotta give this place 5 stars - fast attentive service, relaxing atmosphere and most of all quality sushi at a reasonable price.  I recommend the signature I Love Sushi roll if you like spicy excellence.
One of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas. Very very very fresh sashimi!! Friendly staff!!! 5 stars!!

IMO the best rolls I have ever had. We had 4 for lunch and of course I ordered and as usual over ordered. Everything we tried was superb and very fresh. Large portions for the cut rolls and some very unique combos. They have a huge menu with well over a hundred different combos of rolls some fried but most just very healthy sushi.
Love the ambiance of this place . Ordered the crunch roll and the sashimi cocktail! Sooooo goood !!!

A great place to eat rolls. They proved me wrong that 'sushi' isn't always about nigiri and sashimi. Atmosphere is great, the rolls hardly have any rice, and tons of fresh fish....mmm.. I LOVE, I LOVE SUSHI!! The bill may be pricey because its not all you can eat, BUT nonetheless its worth every grain of rice!!! Trust me, I've only been doing ayce at sushi houses for the past six years only because I didn't believe in getting full off of rolls. But I LOVE SUSHI can create some badass dishes!!!

This is hands down, my favorite sushi restaurant! My favorite items include the: Screaming Orgasm, Burning Your Stomach roll and the Jackpot roll, just to name a few. I've been going here for years. There's no all you can eat option, but the food is just so amazing!

As sushi places go, I Love Sushi is just fine. The fish was fresh, if unremarkably presented. The edamame was a bit overdone, and the pods were not nearly as fresh and green as I've had in other places, and the miso soup was just OK. Before we ordered we were given a little taste teaser of cucumbers drenched in a vinegary concoction; might have been nice but the cukes were pretty soggy.  Prices are extremely fair, no issues there.   The waitress gave us a warm towels for our hands before beginning our meal, a nice touch!  The atmosphere is comfortable; it is a large restaurant with white tablecloths, and the noise level was nicely muted, not loud at all.  I join other yelpers in wishing for the half-star option, because I would have given I Love Sushi 3-1/2 stars. I rounded down to 3 stars, because as the service was excellent, it was also somewhat mechanical, but mostly I rounded down because of the aforementioned glitches with the edamame and cucumber teaser.  I will say that based on the many sushi restaurants I have patronized, I would rate I Love Sushi as average. I wouldn't hesitate to come here again, but I would probably choose another restaurant if given the choice.

This is my first time eating here! Been to different japanese place and this is second to none... Their food is very good with good ambience... Even though, this place is way far from where I live... im still going to drive just to eat here because their food is worth it... the staff are wearing japanese clothes, they are friendly and approachable.... They are very knowledgeable with the menu...

I usually love this place but sub par tonight ; I think they were too busy for their good. And the service was ok... But I thought it was weird when another waitress grabbed our check (at the end) and checked the tip. Get it together guys!

Where do you go for some off strip sushi to die for? "I Love Sushi" of course. I didnt know what to expect especially from a place called I Love Sushi, let alone it being located in a strip mall. Boy we're we surprised. This place was huge and had about 20 sushi chefs working behind the counter. The place was packed on a Tuesday night. I think the place seats about 200 easily. Wow. The food was awesome. AWESOME. The rolls were about $12-15 each but boy were they worth it. I guess one of the gimmicks of this place is the names of the rolls.
